get.summary: Get accounts collection on the ST server.
get.description:
Get method returns fully equipped accounts or partial ones based on 'fields' query parameter. One of these links is 'certificates'. 

`Permissions`: "USER_ACCOUNT_FORM", "SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FORM", "TEMPLATES_FORM". 

Three certificate types are supported for an account object - login, partner and private. `Login` certificates are used when an account needs to login to ST Server using a certificate or SSH Key. `Partner` certificates are used for encrypting PGP and AS2 data to an account and verifying the signature of data from an account. `Private` certificates are used by ST Server to login to remote Transfer Sites for account as well as for decryption and signing of PGP and AS2 data. 

`Implementation note:` Searching for account by properties you must specify additional property **type**. Otherwise search is available only for common properties of accounts (name, uid, gid, skin, lastModified, authByEmail,  disabled, transfersWebServiceAllowed, pesitId, accountCreationDate, transferType, accountSubmitForApprove, businessUnit, rejectReason,  accountEncryptMode, subscriptionFolderDiscovery, fileArchivingPolicy, mappedUser, homeFolderAccessLevel, notes, loginRestrictionPolicy,  accountVerificationStatus, additionalAttributes, adhocSettings, contact).

  When trying to filter by fields exclusive to a certain account type, the type property must be specified.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of the listed rows. The limit parameter can has only nonnegative integer value. If the limit parameter is set to 0 or it is null then its value will be the value of the global server configuration parameter named 'Webservices.EntriesPerPage' (which by default has value 100).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The start row to list. The offset parameter can has only nonnegative integer value. If this parameter is not set, then it is considered 0.

post.description:
`Permissions`: "USER_ACCOUNT_FORM", "SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FORM", "TEMPLATES_FORM". 

Depending on the account `type` property there are three types of accounts: user, service and template.

Accounts support additional attributes which can be added via the ST RESTful API. The additional attributes are specified in `additionalAttributes` property using the following format: `{attribute_name}: {attribute_value}`. 

Accounts support repository encryption mode named `accountEncryptMode`. There are two possible options for the encryptMode: 'ENABLED' and 'UNSPECIFIED'. When ENABLED is set then repository encryption for the account is enabled. When UNSPECIFIED is set then repository encryption for the account is not enabled and can be specified with EncryptClass. 

Accounts support a custom property named 'transfersWebServiceAllowed' which is an attribute name to indicate whether access to the transfers resource from the end user RESTful API is allowed.

Accounts support a custom property named 'transferType' which is an attribute name to indicate the transfer type of the account's transfer site. It can be unspecified (`N`), internal (`I`), partner(`E`). By default is unspecified.

Accounts support PeSIT Store and Forward mode via property named 'routingMode'. There are three possible options for the routingMode: `accept` (the value for Routing Mode that accept transfers), `reject` (the value for Routing Mode that reject transfers) and `ignore` (the value for Routing Mode that ignores transfers). By default is 'reject'.

Accounts support a custom property named 'subscriptionFolderDiscovery' that defines how the subscription folder is discovered. There are two possible options for the subscriptionFolderDiscovery - `ITERATIVE` and `RECURSIVE`. When 'ITERATIVE' is set, then subscription folder discovery is performed by iterating over all of the account's subscriptions while trying to match the target folder. Should be used when the number of subscriptions is small and the target folder depth is large. When 'RECURSIVE' is set, then subscription folder discovery is performed by recursively checking the target folder - the target folder is checked first, then moving up to parent folders. Should be used when the number of subscriptions is large and the target folder depth is small. The default value is: 'ITERATIVE'.

Accounts support a custom property named 'fileArchivingPolicy' that can be set only if the global File Archiving is anabled. There are three possible options for the fileArchivingPolicy - `enabled`, `disabled` and `default`. When 'enabled' is set, file archiving will be enabled for this account. When 'disabled' is set, file archiving will be disabled for this account. When 'default' is set, then the following apply: if the account is assigned to business unit, it will inherit its policy, otherwise, the global archiving policy applies.

Accounts support a custom property name 'bandwidthInboundLimit' which defines maximum kb/s applied for HTTP/FTP/SSH inbound transfers per account. The limit will be applied regardless of cluster/streaming deployment configurations or number of sessions open up by each account.

Accounts support a custom property name 'bandwidthOutboundLimit' which defines maximum kb/s applied for HTTP/FTP/SSH outbound transfers per account. The limit will be applied regardless of cluster/streaming deployment configurations or number of sessions open up by each account.

Accounts which are part of the Maker/Checker process flow support the following custom properties named 'accountVerificationStatus', 'accountSubmitForApprove' and 'rejectReason'.
- The 'accountVerificationStatus' property indicates whether the account is verified, rejected or pending approval. It has three possible values - 'PENDING', 'APPROVED' and  'REJECTED'. Its value can be changed by Checker or Master administrator.
- The 'accountSubmitForApprove' property indicates whether the account is submitted by Maker administrator to be verified by Checker administrator. It can be either 'true' or 'false'. Its value can be changed by Maker or Master administrator. Checker administrators can update the verification status of submitted for approval accounts.
- The 'rejectReason' property can be used to store reasons for rejection and additional notes by Checker and Master administratos.

If an account's type is a template, additional templateClass(String) variable is required - the user class of the template account.

When an account has user current password policies will be applied if the password has been specified. If passwordDigest is specified password policies will not be applied.

parameters.name: ownershipChangeMode
parameters.description:
Controls how the subfolders of the home folder are affected upon UID/GID or homeFolder change.
* `none` - The UID/GID of the home folder and its subfolders is not affected.
* `nonRecursive` - Changes only the home folder.
* `recursive` - Also changes the UID/GID of all subfolders and files.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Defines maximum count of returned entries. Expects positive integer value. If this parameter is not specified, then SecureTransport sets a default one. This parameter is used in conjunction with offset query parameter to get entries at portions.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Defines the first entry number of an ordered result to get; last entry number to return is (offset + limit - 1). Expects positive integer value. If this parameter is not specified, then SecureTransport sets a default one. This parameter is used in conjunction with limit query parameter to get entries at portions.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Defines maximum count of returned entries. Expects positive integer value. If this parameter is not specified, then SecureTransport sets a default one. This parameter is used in conjunction with offset query parameter to get entries at portions.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Defines the first entry number of an ordered result to get; last entry number to return is (offset + limit - 1). Expects positive integer value. If this parameter is not specified, then SecureTransport sets a default one. This parameter is used in conjunction with limit query parameter to get entries at portions.

get.summary: Get collection of applications on the ST server.
get.description:
`Permissions`: "APPLICATION_FORM". 

 `Implementation note:` Searching for application by properties you must specify additional property **type**. 

 Otherwise search is available only for common properties of application (*id*, *name*, *notes*).

  When trying to filter by fields exclusive to a certain application type, the type property must be specified.

  Searching properties or filtering by fields exclusive to a certain schedule type, the schedules.type parameter must be specified.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of entries to list (the number must be a positive number). If limit is set to 0 then the default limit value of 100 entries applies. The maximum allowed number of entries is 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset from the first result. By default is 0.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Set of comma separated strings of applications properties to return.

**Note:** The type field will always be present.

parameters.description: The application name to filter by.

parameters.description: The application type to filter by.

post.summary: Create an application on the ST server.
post.description:
Depending on the application `type` property there are 18 types of accounts: 'HumanSystem', 'StandardRouter', 'SiteMailbox', 'SharedFolder', 'TransferLogMaint', 'Basic', 'AdvancedRouting', 'LogEntryMaint', 'ArchiveMaint', 'SentinelLinkDataMaint', 'SynchronyTransfer', 'MBFT', 'PackageRetentionMaint', 'UnlicensedAccountMaint', 'AuditLogMaint', 'LoginThresholdMaintenance', 'AccountTTL' and 'AccountFilePurge'.

`Permissions`: "APPLICATION_FORM".

Note: application types that does not support subscribing to are: 'TransferLogMaint', 'LogEntryMaint', 'ArchiveMaint', 'SentinelLinkDataMaint', 'UnlicensedAccountMaint', 'PackageRetentionMaint', 'AccountTTL', 'AccountFilePurge'

 Certificate properties 'keySize', 'validityPeriod', 'caPassword', 'password' and 'keyAlgorithm' are used only for certificate generation, they can not be get (listed) via the REST API (they have value null).

 When the HSM is enabled for FTP, HTTP, or SSH, the public key fingerprint cannot be loaded from the store, so the value is reported as null.

post.summary: Create or import a certificate on the ST server.
post.description:
`Permissions`: "MASTER_CERT_MGR_FORM_1", "MASTER_CERT_MGR_FORM_2", "MASTER_CERT_MGR_FORM_3", "MASTER_CERT_MGR_FORM", "USER_ACCOUNT_FORM", "SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FORM", "TEMPLATES_FORM".

On user account level there are three types of certificates depending on the certificate usage - `login`, `private` and `partner`. 

**Notes:** 
    - Only 'ca' trusted certificate could be regenerated.
    - Regenerated 'ca' trustedcertificate can not be of type 'pgp'. 
    - Login certificates can not be of type 'pgp'.

 **Known issue:** `multipart/mixed` mode cannot be used with Swagger Client (refer to https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-js/issues/2473). **Please, note that importing a certificate using SwaggerUI would fail.** More information and working examples can be found at https://support.axway.com/kb/181603/language/en. 

 **Known issue:** The MIME boundary is hardcoded to 'BOUNDARY' because of swagger limitations (refer to https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/3.0.1.md#parameterIn for more information).

 **Known issue:** The import of x509 certificates of local and private usage can not be done via text representation of the certificate. This can be done with importing the PKCS #12 format file.

 **Known issue:** Certificate import requires additional file with the certificate content because of swagger limitations (refer to https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-ui/issues/5090).

requestBody.description: The certificate to be created or imported.

201.description: Successfully created certificate.

get.description:
A login certificate could be exported only by certificate id. If export
the private key of a trusted certificate then the private key protection
password is required.

When the HSM is enabled for FTP, HTTP, or SSH, the public key fingerprint cannot be loaded from the store, so the value is reported as null.

** Known Issue: Applicable when exporting certificate. https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-ui/issues/5293 **

`Permissions`: "MASTER_CERT_MGR_FORM_1", "MASTER_CERT_MGR_FORM_2", "MASTER_CERT_MGR_FORM_3", "MASTER_CERT_MGR_FORM", "USER_ACCOUNT_FORM", "SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FORM", "TEMPLATES_FORM".

parameters.description: Applicable for GET with json. Whether the fingerprint should be Base64 encoded. Use for generation.

parameters.description: Applicable for GET with multipart. REQUIRED for exporting private key of certificate.

parameters.description: Applicable for GET with multipart.

parameters.description: Applicable for GET with multipart. The SSH Public key format to be returned.

parameters.description: Defines whether to return all available entries. When true, only the latest entry of a sequence of related logs would be returned.

parameters.description: The name of the server processing the transfer

parameters.name: filename

parameters.description: The local name of the transferred file. Supports wildcard search.

parameters.description: The user class. Default values are 'VirtClass' and 'RealClass'.

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: The name of the transfer site. Supports wildcard search.

parameters.name: site.id
parameters.description: The id of the transfer site.

parameters.name: transferProfile
parameters.description: Transfer profile of the site (PeSIT related).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: A list of transfer statuses. It can be 'In Progress', 'Processed', 'Failed', 'Aborted', 'Pending receipt', 'Failed Subtransmission', 'Paused', 'Failed Transfer Resubmit' or 'Waiting'.

parameters.name: transferId
parameters.description: The id of the transfer status entry.

parameters.name: startTimeBefore
parameters.description: The time before which the transfer started as RFC2822 string - EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z.

parameters.name: startTimeAfter
parameters.description: The time after which the transfer started as RFC2822 string - EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z.

parameters.name: endTimeBefore
parameters.description: The time before which the transfer ended as RFC2822 string - EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z.

parameters.name: endTimeAfter
parameters.description: The time after which the transfer ended as RFC2822 string - EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z.

parameters.name: serverInitiated
parameters.description: Defines whether the transfer is server or client initiated

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: The protocol of the site. It can be 'as2', 'ftp', 'http', 'ssh', 'pesit', 'folder', 'adhoc' as well as the protocols added with transfer site plugins.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: A list of application names.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: A list of transfer directions. It can be 'Incoming' or 'Outgoing'.

parameters.name: incoming
parameters.description: Defines whether the transfer direction is incoming or outgoing

parameters.name: secure
parameters.description: Defines whether the transfer is secure or non-secure.

parameters.name: resubmitted
parameters.description: Defines whether the transfer is resubmitted or not-resubmitted. It can be 'false' or 'true'.

parameters.name: operationIndex
parameters.description: A list of operation indexes. It can be '(none)' or some ID.

parameters.name: coreId
parameters.description: The coreId of the transfer entry.

parameters.name: filesize
parameters.description: Transfered file size

parameters.name: remoteDir
parameters.description: Remote directory.

parameters.name: remotePartner
parameters.description: Remote partner that gets/sends the file.

parameters.name: securityParameters
parameters.description: Negotiated during handshake session security parameters

parameters.name: actionBy
parameters.description: Defines who initiated the transfer. It can be 'User' or 'Server'

parameters.name: cycleId
parameters.description: The Cycle Id

post.summary: Perform an operation for specific transfer.
post.description:
You can cancel or resubmit a transfer, verify an MDN, or manually acknowledge a received PeSIT transfer. An acknowledgment, either positive (ack) or negative (nack), can be sent only for transfers that have not been previously acknowledged.

`Permissions`: "TRANSFER_LOG_FORM".

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Base64-encoded composite parameter in the format 'Id [mTransferStatusId=var1, mTransferStartTime=var2]', where var1 is the transfer id and var2 is the transfer start time in unix format.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Which transfer operation to be performed.

requestBody.description:
Optional message that could be sent `ONLY` during `ack/nack` operations. To add a custom value to the `User Message (PI99)` via ack/nack, enter the value (string) between the double quotation marks, in the example below.

 This field supports Expression Language. Valid expressions are:

 * `${pesit.accountName}` - The acknowledgement originator (account name for manual acknowledgements).

 * `${pesit.datetime}` - Date and time of the acknowledgement.

 If the message is empty, the template from `Pesit.Transfer.Acknowledge` configuration property will be used by default.

post.description:
Use the resource to authenticate a user to SecureTransport. SecureTransport will return session cookies, reuse of which will allow subsequent APIs to be issued without having to re-authenticate.

You can observe the usage of curl's --cookie-jar option for storing cookies and --cookie for reading them in the next curl command, i.e. reuse the authentication.

For example:

curl -k --cookie-jar cookie.jar -u "user:password" -X POST "https://\<IP\>:\<PORT\>/api/v2.0/myself" -H "accept: application/json" -H "Referer: Random_Text_Here"

400.description: Bad request - server could not understand the request due to invalid syntax.

delete.description:
Use the resource to logout an authenticated user from SecureTransport.

You can observe the usage of curl's --cookie-jar option for storing cookies and --cookie for reading them in the next curl command, i.e. reuse the authentication.

For example:

curl -k -L --cookie cookie.jar -X DELETE "https://\<IP\>:\<PORT\>/api/v2.0/myself" -H "accept: application/json" -H "Referer: Random_Text_Here"

post.summary: Create a route on the ST server.
post.description:
It is possible to create three types of Route: TEMPLATE, COMPOSITE, SIMPLE.

The types are used as follows:

Template route type: 
- it can have businessUnits property which is a list of business unit names appropriate for the Administrator who is creating this route
- it may not have account property
- it may not have subscriptions property
- it may not have routeTemplate property

Composite route type: 
- it is to have routeTemplate property pointing to the id of an existing Template Route visible by the account this route is created for 
- it can have account property which is the name of an existing account
- it can have subscriptions property which is a list of subscription id-s which belongs to the account this route is created for
- it may not have businessUnits property

Simple Route:
- it may not have businessUnits property
- it may not have account property
- it may not have subscriptions property
- it may not have routeTemplate property

The route to be created may not have steps property. Steps are managed by the sub-resource steps.

When creating a composite route type to  link a TEMPLATE route to an account, the new composite route properties to set are: name, type - COMPOSITE, routeTemplate - <simple_route_id>, failureEmailNotification, failureEmailTemplate,  failureEmailName, successEmailNotification, successEmailTemplate, successEmailName, conditionType, account - <account or login name to link to>, subscriptions - ["account_subscribtion_id1", "account_subscribtion_id2", ...].

patch.description:
Refer to the schema to see how to use the PATCH method or for more information about every step and available properties.

Applicable only for route of type COMPOSITE:
* account, subscriptions and routeTemplate.

Applicable only for route of type TEMPLATE:
* businessUnits.

Read only fields for all route types:
* type, id.

Applicable for all route types:
* when patching failureEmailNotification to true you must also supply either failureEmailTemplate or failureEmailName otherwise the request will fail.
* when patching triggeringEmailNotification to true you must also supply either triggeringEmailTemplate or triggeringEmailName otherwise the request will fail.
* when patching successEmailNotification to true you must also supply either successEmailTemplate or successEmailName otherwise the request will fail.

steps:
* ExecuteRoute step is used with only routes of type TEMPLATE or COMPOSITE
* All other steps are used with only routes of type SIMPLE

get.description:
`Permissions`: "USER_ACCOUNT_FORM", "SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FORM", "TEMPLATES_FORM". 

 `Implementation note:` Searching for site by properties you must specify additional property **type**. 

 Otherwise search is available only for common properties of sites (*maxConcurrentConnection*, *isDefault*, *accessLevel*, *account*, *siteTemplate*, *name*, *protocol*).

 When trying to filter by fields exclusive to a certain site type, the type property must be specified.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of the listed rows. The limit parameter can has only nonnegative integer value. If the limit parameter is set to 0 or it is null then its value will be the value of the global server configuration parameter named `Webservices.EntriesPerPage` (which by default has value 100).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The start row to list. The offset parameter can has only nonnegative integer value. If this parameter is not set, then it is considered 0.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
The site's fields to return.

**Note:** The type field will always be present.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Discriminator to filter by.

**Note:** Type custom can only be used to filter by fields exclusive to a custom site type.

parameters.description: The name of the site. Does not require type.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: The protocol of the site. Does not require type.

post.description:
`Permissions`: "USER_ACCOUNT_FORM", "SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FORM", "TEMPLATES_FORM".

**Note:** All fields of type string for the internal transfer sites (besides AS2 and System to Human) support Expression Language (EL), except those regarding certificates and enum ones.
Refer to the schema for each transfer site. Valid expressions are:
* custom properties passed in a REST API Pull/Push request via the '/transfers/operations' resource - "${DXAGENT_TRANSFERSAPI_*}"
* SecureTransport specific named variable sets - "${stenv.variable}" and "${env['variable']}"
* predefined functions using EL - "{concat("var1", "var2")}}"

**Note**: To create a transfer site and use the placeholder default values of the selected site template, add a trailing hyphen to the placeholder name: "testPlaceholder-": ""
              Use of default placeholder values is applicable with the following transfer sites only: Connect:Direct, Synchrony, File Services interface protocol.

parameters.description: Defines whether folder names to be included in list operation response. Available for listRemoteFolder operation only.

parameters.name: folderToList
parameters.description: Defines the remote folder on which listRemoteFolder operation will be performed. If the parameter is set to downloadFolder - list operation will be performed on download folder, otherwise operation will be performed on upload folder. Available for listRemoteFolder operation only.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of the listed files and folders. If the limit parameter is set to 0 or it is null then its value will be the value of the global server configuration parameter named 'ListRemoteFolder.Result.Files.Limit' (which by default has value 50). If the limit parameter is set to -1 - all files and folders will be included in list operation result. Available for listRemoteFolder operation only.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of the listed rows. The limit parameter can has only nonnegative integer value. If the limit parameter is set to 0 or it is null then its value will be the value of the global server configuration parameter named `Webservices.EntriesPerPage` (which by default has value 100).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The start row to list. The offset parameter can has only nonnegative integer value. If this parameter is not set, then it is considered 0.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The transfer profiles' fields to return.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the transfer profile.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The account for which the transfer profile is created.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Defines whether the transfer profile is default or not.

parameters.name: sendMapping
parameters.description: The send mapping of the transfer profile.

parameters.name: receiveMapping
parameters.description: The receive mapping of the transfer profile. The transfer profile's `Receive File as` mapping may not contain '*' or '?'.

parameters.name: fileLabelOption
parameters.description: The file label option of the transfer profile. Corresponds to PI 37 code.

parameters.name: multiSelect
parameters.description: Defines whether multi select is chosen.

parameters.name: transferMode
parameters.description: The mode of the transfer profile.

parameters.name: recordFormat
parameters.description: The record format of the transfer profile. It can be variable (128) or fixed (0). Corresponds to PI 31 code.

parameters.name: recordLength
parameters.description: The record length of the transfer profile. It should be positive. Corresponds to PI 32 code number.

parameters.name: sendingAcknowledgmentEnabled
parameters.description: Defines whether the sending acknowledgment is enabled.

parameters.description: Defines whether the padding strip is enabled.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.callerTranscoding.localDataCode
parameters.description: The file encoding of sending side of the transfer profile. It can be binary, ascii or ebcdic.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.callerTranscoding.type
parameters.description: Determines whether and what transcoding to be applied. Acts as a discriminator and is case sensitive.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.callerTranscoding.transcoding
parameters.description: Read-only field displayed when predefined "type" is used.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.callerTranscoding.networkDataCode
parameters.description: Defines the value of PI 16 - the data coding of the network file. The field is Read-only, populated based on type, when type is ASCII or EBCDIC.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.callerTranscoding.sourceEncodingScheme
parameters.description: The encoding scheme of the source file. Can be one of the system supported charsets.  Applicable only for ascii_predefined and ebcdic_predefined types.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.callerTranscoding.outputEncodingScheme
parameters.description: The encoding scheme of the output file. Can be one of the system supported charsets.  Applicable only for ascii_predefined and ebcdic_predefined types.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.callerTranscoding.outputRecordFormat
parameters.description: The record format of the transfer profile. Corresponds to PI 31 code.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.callerTranscoding.outputRecordLength
parameters.description: The record length of the transfer profile. It should be positive number. Corresponds to PI 32 code.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.callerTranscoding.paddingCharacter
parameters.description: The padding character can be UNICODE or ASCII and specified by its hexadecimal value.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.receiverTranscoding.type
parameters.description: Determines whether and what transcoding to be applied. Acts as a discriminator and is case sensitive.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.receiverTranscoding.transcoding
parameters.description: Read-only field displayed when predefined "type" is used.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.receiverTranscoding.localDataCode
parameters.description: Read-only field populated based on "type". The data coding of the file on the local file system.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.receiverTranscoding.sourceEncodingScheme
parameters.description: The encoding scheme of the source file. Can be one of the system supported charsets.  Applicable only for predefined type.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.receiverTranscoding.outputEncodingScheme
parameters.description: The encoding scheme of the output file. Can be one of the system supported charsets.  Applicable only for predefined type.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.receiverTranscoding.outputRecordFormat
parameters.description: The record format of the transfer profile.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.receiverTranscoding.outputRecordLength
parameters.description: The record length of the transfer profile. It should be positive number.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.receiverTranscoding.paddingCharacter
parameters.description: The padding character can be UNICODE or ASCII and specified by its hexadecimal value.

parameters.name: advancedSettings.receiverTranscoding.lineEndingFormat
parameters.description: Line ending of the receiving side of the transfer profile.

post.description:
Currently only pull operation is available. Triggers pull event to retrieve files for a given transfer pull.

The "customProperties" field is a map, consisting of "key":"value" pairs, that can be referenced by the Transfer Site (TS)
using SecureTransport Expression Language (EL) with the "DXAGENT_TRANSFERSAPI_" prefix. For example, given a key "foo" with a value of "bar",
we can access it in the TS using ${DXAGENT_TRANSFERSAPI_FOO} for properties which support EL and it would be evaluated to "bar".
The transfer sites which support these expressions are FTP, HTTP, SSH, PeSIT and Folder Monitor.

**Note:** The keys in the "customProperties" map are case insensitive.

`Permissions`: "USER_ACCOUNT_FORM", "TRANSFER_LOG_FORM"

get.summary: Get collection of subscriptions on the ST server.
get.description:
`Permissions`: "USER_ACCOUNT_FORM", "SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FORM", "TEMPLATES_FORM". 

 `Implementation note:` Searching for subscription by properties you must specify additional property **type**. 

 Otherwise search is available only for common properties of subscription (*type*, *account*, *application*, *flowAttributes*, *flowAttrsMergeMode*, *flowName*, *folder*, *folderMonitorScheduleCheck*, *maxParallelSitPulls*, *scheduledFolderMonitor*, *subscriptionEncryptMode*, *fileRetentionPeriod*, *flowAttributes.value*, *flowAttributes.key*).

  When trying to filter by fields exclusive to a certain subscription type, the type property must be specified.

  Searching properties or filtering by fields exclusive to a certain schedule type, the schedules.type parameter must be specified.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of the listed rows. The limit parameter can has only nonnegative integer value. If the limit parameter is set to 0 or it is null then its value will be the value of the global server configuration parameter named `Webservices.EntriesPerPage` (which by default has value 100).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The start row to list. The offset parameter can has only nonnegative integer value. If this parameter is not set, then it is considered 0.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Set of comma separated strings of subscription properties to return.

**Note:** The type field will always be present.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The account name to filter by.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: The application name to filter by.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Discriminator to filter by.

parameters.name: schedules.type
parameters.description: The schedules type to filter by.

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: The subscription folder to filter by. The file path should be provided e.g '/TEST'

parameters.name: maxParallelSitPulls
parameters.description: Custom attribute under which we store the option for maximum sit pulls to be executed simultaneously. Negative value or 0 - no limit, positive value 4 - limits simultaneously

parameters.name: flowAttrsMergeMode
parameters.description: The flow merge mode.

parameters.name: folderMonitorScheduleCheck
parameters.description: Whether a folder monitor subscription is scheduled.

parameters.name: flowAttributes.key
parameters.description: Search by userVars key.

parameters.name: flowAttributes.value
parameters.description: Search by userVars value.

parameters.name: scheduledFolderMonitor
parameters.description: Specify if this subscription is targeted for a scheduled folder monitor.

parameters.name: fileRetentionPeriod
parameters.description: Search by fileRetentionPeriod value. If this parameter is not set, then it is considered 0.

parameters.name: subscriptionEncryptMode
parameters.description: Encryption that will be used for subscription folder. Accepting one of default, enabled, disabled.

parameters.name: flowAttributeKey
parameters.description: Search by flowAtrribute key.

parameters.name: flowAttributeValue
parameters.description: Search by flowAtrribute value.

parameters.name: templateAdvancedExpression
parameters.description: Specify if advanced expressions section be displayed in Admin UI Subscriptions page. Applicable for Basic, SharedFolder, SiteMailbox subscriptions.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.id
parameters.description: Search by id of transfer configuration.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.tag
parameters.description: Search by tag of transfer configuration.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.outbound
parameters.description: Search by direction of transfer configuration. If true, subscriptions with outbound transfer configurations will be returned, else subscriptions with inbound transfer configrations.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.site
parameters.description: Search by transfer site name of transfer configuration.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.transferProfile
parameters.description: Search by transfer profile of transfer configuration.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.id
parameters.description: Search by id of transfer configuration's data transformation.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.type
parameters.description: Search by type of transfer configuration's data transformation.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.asciiArmor
parameters.description: Search by asciiArmor of transfer configuration's data transformation. Specify if SecureTransport uses ASCII armor encoding. ASCII armor refers to using binary-to-text encoding for plain text data.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.compressionAlgorithm
parameters.description: Search by compressionAlgorithm of transfer configuration's data transformation. Possible values are -1 (Preffered), 0 (No compression), 1 (ZIP), 2 (ZLIB) or 3 (BZIP2). Preferred compression methods and order of preference are determined by examining the recipient's PGP key. If the data compression method you choose is not among the recipient's preferred methods, it is possible that the recipient will not be able to access the data.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.compressionLevel
parameters.description: Search by compressionLevel of transfer configuration's data transformation. Possible values are 2 (Fast), 5 (Normal), 7 (Good) or 9 (Best).

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.encryptEnabled
parameters.description: Search by encryptEnabled property of transfer configuration's data transformation.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.localSignCertificate
parameters.description: Search by localSignCertificate of transfer configuration's data transformation.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.originalNameExpressionEnabled
parameters.description: Search by originalNameExpressionEnabled of transfer configuration's data transformation.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.originalNameExpression
parameters.description: Search by originalNameExpression of transfer configuration's data transformation.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.partnerEncryptCertificate
parameters.description: Search by partnerEncryptCertificate of transfer configuration's data transformation.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.requireEncryption
parameters.description: Search by requireEncryption of transfer configuration's data transformation.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.requireSignature
parameters.description: Search by requireSignature of transfer configuration's data transformation.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.signingEnabled
parameters.description: Search by signingEnabled of transfer configuration's data transformation.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.transformedNameExpressionEnabled
parameters.description: Search by transformedNameExpressionEnabled property of transfer configuration's data transformation.

parameters.name: transferConfigurations.dataTransformations.transformedNameExpression
parameters.description: Search by transformedNameExpression of transfer configuration's data transformation.

parameters.name: postClientDownloads.postClientDownloadActionType
parameters.description: Specify if Post Client Download Actions will be applied to each file successfully downloaded from the subscription folder. It can be 'DELETE' or no property at all. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postClientDownloads.postClientDownloadActionTypeFailure
parameters.description: Advanced Routing setting for post client download action type option on failure. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postClientDownloads.postClientDownloadTypeOnFailDoAdvancedRouting
parameters.description: Whether to trigger advanced routing in case of a failed post client download. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postClientDownloads.postClientDownloadTypeOnFailDoAdvancedRoutingProcessFailedFile
parameters.description: Defines whether to trigger advanced routing with file copy in case of a failed post client download. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postClientDownloads.postClientDownloadTypeOnPermfailDoDelete
parameters.description: Defines whether to delete the file in case of a permanent failure of a post client download. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postClientDownloads.postClientDownloadTypeOnSuccessDoAdvancedRouting
parameters.description: Defines whether to trigger advanced routing in case of a successful post client download. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postClientDownloads.postClientDownloadTypeOnSuccessDoAdvancedRoutingProcessFile
parameters.description: Defines whether to trigger advanced routing with file copy in case of a successful post client download. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postProcessingActions.ppaOnFailInDoDelete
parameters.description: Defines whether to delete the file on failure after the transmission. This action is applied to files arrived to this folder and processed by a route package. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postProcessingActions.ppaOnFailInDoMove
parameters.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on failure. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder. This action is applied to files arrived to this folder and processed by a route package. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postProcessingActions.ppaOnSuccessInDoDelete
parameters.description: Defines whether to delete the file on success after the transmission. This action is applied to files arrived to this folder and processed by a route package. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postProcessingActions.ppaOnSuccessInDoMove
parameters.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on success. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder. This action is applied to files arrived to this folder and processed by a route package. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.moveOverwrite
parameters.description: Delete the target file and repeat the rename operation. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnTempfailInDoDelete
parameters.description: Defines whether to delete the file on failure after the transmission. Applicable for AdvancedRouting, Basic, SharedFolder, SiteMailbox and StandardRouter subscriptions.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnTempfailInDoMove
parameters.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on temporary failure. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder. Applicable for AdvancedRouting, Basic, SharedFolder, SiteMailbox and StandardRouter subscriptions.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnPermfailInDoDelete
parameters.description: Defines whether to delete the file on failure after the transmission. Applicable for AdvancedRouting, Basic, SharedFolder, SiteMailbox and StandardRouter subscriptions.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnPermfailInDoMove
parameters.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on failure. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder. Applicable for AdvancedRouting, Basic, SharedFolder, SiteMailbox and StandardRouter subscriptions.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnPermfailDoAdvancedRouting
parameters.description: Defines whether to trigger advanced routing in case of a PTA permanent failure. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnPermfailInDoAdvancedRoutingFailedFile
parameters.description: Defines whether to trigger advanced routing with file copy in case of a PTA permanent failure. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnPermfailInDoAdvancedRoutingWildcardPull
parameters.description: Defines whether to trigger wildcard pull with advanced routing in case of a PTA permanent failure. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnTempfailInDoAdvancedRouting
parameters.description: Defines whether to trigger advanced routing in case of a PTA temporary failure. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnTempfailInDoAdvancedRoutingProcessFailedFile
parameters.description: Defines whether to trigger advanced routing with file copy in case of a PTA permanent failure. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnTempfailInDoAdvancedRoutingWildcardPull
parameters.description: Defines whether to trigger wildcard pull with advanced routing in case of a PTA temporary failure. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnSuccessDoInAdvancedRoutingWildcardPull
parameters.description: Defines whether to trigger wildcard pull with advanced routing in case of a PTA success. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnSuccessInDoDelete
parameters.description: Defines whether to delete the source file on success after the transmission. Applicable for AdvancedRouting, Basic, SharedFolder, SiteMailbox and StandardRouter subscriptions.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnSuccessInDoMove
parameters.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on success. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder. Applicable for AdvancedRouting, Basic, SharedFolder, SiteMailbox and StandardRouter subscriptions.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnSuccessInDoMoveOverwrite
parameters.description: When the "Allow Overwrite Existing File" option is enabled and the rename operation fails because the target file exists, ST will delete the target file and repeat the rename operation. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnPermfailOutDoDelete
parameters.description: Defines whether to delete the file on failure after the transmission. Applicable for AdvancedRouting, Basic, SiteMailbox and StandardRouter subscriptions.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnPermfailOutDoMove
parameters.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on permanent failure. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder. Applicable for AdvancedRouting, Basic, SiteMailbox and StandardRouter subscriptions.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnSuccessOutDoDelete
parameters.description: Defines whether to delete the file on success after the transmission. Applicable for AdvancedRouting, Basic, SiteMailbox and StandardRouter subscriptions.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnSuccessOutDoMove
parameters.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on success. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder. Applicable for AdvancedRouting, Basic, SiteMailbox and StandardRouter subscriptions.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnSuccessOutDoMoveOverwrite
parameters.description: When the "Allow Overwrite Existing File" option is enabled and the rename operation fails because the target file exists, ST will delete the target file and repeat the rename operation. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnTempfailOutDoDelete
parameters.description: Defines whether to delete the file on failure after the transmission. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.ptaOnTempfailOutDoMove
parameters.description: Specify a value to rename the file after transmission or move it to a different folder on failure. An expression language can be used to specify a file name/folder. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.triggerOnConditionEnabled
parameters.description: If checked, processing of files in the subscription folder will be triggered upon a specific condition. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.triggerOnConditionExpression
parameters.description: Specify the condition on which to trigger file processing. An expression language can be used. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.triggerOnSuccessfulWildcardPull
parameters.description: Setting for trigger on successful wildcard pull. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.submitFilterType
parameters.description: Specify the submit filter type. It could be 'FILENAME_PATTERN' or 'TRIGGER_FILE_CONTENT'. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.submitFilenamePatternExpression
parameters.description: Specify the file name pattern. An expression language can be used. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.triggerFileOption
parameters.description: Specify the trigger file option. It could be 'fail', 'continue' or 'retry'. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.triggerFileRetriesNumber
parameters.description: Specify the trigger file maximum retries number. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription when 'triggerFileOption' option is set to 'retry'.

parameters.name: postTransmissionActions.triggerFileRetryDelay
parameters.description: Specify the interval in seconds, when next trigger file retry will be executed. Applicable for AdvancedRouting subscription when 'triggerFileOption' option is set to 'retry'.

parameters.description: The subscriber ID. Applicable for StandardRouter subscription.

post.summary: Create subscription on the ST server.
post.description:
Subscriptions support custom attributes which can be added via the ST RESTful API. The custom attributes are in the following format: `userVars.{attribute_name}: {attribute_value}`. 

`Note`: For properties supporting expression language: If the filename expression begins with /, then the transformed file is put in the sub-folder indicated by this filename expression relative to the subscription folder.

put.summary: Update an existing on SecureTransport server user class.
put.description:
The update full overwrite the previously existing user class on the SecureTransport server.
 Required information for the user class
fields(className, userType, address and group) must be specified. Optional properties are: enabled, expression and
order. 

The enabled property is used for enabling or disabling the user class instance.
The order property is used to change the position of the user class. When changing position of the user class instance
all user classes before or after the new user class position will be shifted up or down by one position.

get.description:
`Implementation note:` Searching for server by properties you must specify additional property **protocol**.
  Otherwise search is available only for common properties of servers (serverName, isActive).

  When trying to filter by fields exclusive to a certain server, the protocol property must be specified.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of the listed rows. The limit parameter can only have a non-negative integer value. If the limit parameter is set to 0 or it is null, then its value will be the value of the global server configuration parameter named 'Webservices.EntriesPerPage' (which by default has value 100).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial row to list all administrative roles. The offset parameter can only have a non-negative integer value. If this parameter is not set, then it is considered 0.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
The server's fields to return.

**Note:** The protocol field will always be present.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: The server protocol to filter by.

parameters.name: serverName
parameters.description: The server name

parameters.name: isActive
parameters.description: The current state of the server.

parameters.name: host
parameters.description: Server bind host. Applicable for FTP, SSH, PeSIT

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: Server bind port. Applicable for FTP, SSH

parameters.name: ciphers
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of enabled ciphers. Applicable for FTP, HTTP, SSH, PeSIT

parameters.name: fipsCiphers
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of enabled FIPS ciphers. Applicable for FTP, HTTP, SSH, PeSIT

parameters.name: enabledSslProtocols
parameters.description: The suite of protocols available for the server. Applicable for FTP, HTTP, AS2, PeSIT

parameters.name: isFipsEnabled
parameters.description: FIPS transfer mode. Applicable for FTP, HTTP, SSH, AS2, PeSIT

parameters.name: isFtpsEnabled
parameters.description: Controls whether FTPS is enabled.

parameters.name: isFtpEnabled
parameters.description: Controls whether FTP is enabled.

parameters.name: sslKeyAlgorithm
parameters.description: FTP server SSL key algorithm.

parameters.name: sslProtocol
parameters.description: Server SSL protocol. Applicable for FTP, HTTP

parameters.name: sslTrustAlgorithm
parameters.description: FTP SSL trust algorithm.

parameters.name: certificateAlias
parameters.description: Server certificate alias for FTP, HTTP, SSH server, used for FTPS, HTTPS, SSH connections.

parameters.name: clientCertificateResolution
parameters.description: Controls the status of FTPS, HTTPS, AS2, SSH, PeSIT client certificate authentication.

parameters.name: clientPasswordAuth
parameters.description: Controls if password authentication is enabled as a user authentication method on the SSH server.

parameters.name: passivePortBase
parameters.description: Passive mode base port, 0 means 'let system choose port'. Applicable for FTP

parameters.name: passivePortNumber
parameters.description: Passive mode port range, 0 means 'there are no port range restrictions'. Applicable for FTP

parameters.name: httpPort
parameters.description: HTTP server bind port.

parameters.name: httpsPort
parameters.description: HTTPS server bind port.

parameters.name: isHttpEnabled
parameters.description: HTTP status.

parameters.name: isHttpsEnabled
parameters.description: HTTPS status.

parameters.name: httpHost
parameters.description: HTTP host

parameters.name: httpsHost
parameters.description: HTTPS host

parameters.name: loginFormat
parameters.description: How will the client get challenged for authentication. Applicable for HTTP

parameters.name: allowedAuthenticationParameters
parameters.description: HTTP allowed authentication parameters represented as a semicolon separated list.

parameters.name: allowedAuthenticationParametersMaxSize
parameters.description: HTTP allowed authentication parameters maximum size in bytes.

parameters.name: isHstsEnabled
parameters.description: Enable or disable HSTS for HTTP, AS2 Server. On change, the server must be restarted.

parameters.name: contentSecurityPolicy
parameters.description: Specifies the value of the Content-Security-Policy header for the HTTP server.

parameters.name: xssProtection
parameters.description: Specifies the value of the X-XSS-Protection header for the HTTP server. Accepted values are: 0 | 1 | 1; mode=block |1; report=<reporting url>

parameters.name: contentTypeOptions
parameters.description: Specifies the value of the X-Content-Type-Options header for the HTTP server. Accepted value: nosniff

parameters.name: referrerPolicy
parameters.description: Specifies the value of the Referrer-Policy header for the HTTP server. Accepted values are: no-referrer|no-referrer-when-downgrade|origin|origin-when-cross-origin |same-origin|strict-origin|strict-origin-when-cross-origin|unsafe-url

parameters.name: expectCt
parameters.description: Specifies the value of the Expect-CT header for the HTTP server. Accepted value is: max-age=<age>; enforce; report-uri=<uri>. The enforce and report-uri directives are optional.

parameters.name: httpSecuritySameSite
parameters.description: Specifies value for the SameSite cookie attribute for http. Valid values: None, Lax, Strict. Default value when not set: Strict.

parameters.name: redirectHostname
parameters.description:
When set, all subsequent to first requests to the ST Web client will be bound to that hostname.
This should be used in the case where a DNS switch occurs to avoid requests getting split across different nodes.
Applicable for HTTP.

parameters.name: isScpEnabled
parameters.description: Secure Copy (SCP) status

parameters.name: isSftpEnabled
parameters.description: Secure File TransferProtocol (SFTP) status

parameters.name: keyExchangeAlgorithms
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of supported Key Exchange algorithms for the current SSH server. This option is not honored when FIPS mode is enabled.

parameters.name: fipsKeyExchangeAlgorithms
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of supported Key Exchange algorithms in FIPS mode for the current SSH server.

parameters.name: minDiffieHellmanGroupExchangeKeySize
parameters.description: Define the minimum key size for Diffie-Hellman exchange algorithms group supported by the current SSH server. This value is honored if Diffie-Hellman key exchange algorithm is defined as supported in keyExchangeAlgorithms parameter value.

parameters.name: publicKeys
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of supported public keys for client certificate authentication to current SSH server. This option is not honored when FIPS mode is enabled. The first entry will be set as preferred public key for authentication to SSH daemon.

parameters.name: fipsPublicKeys
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of supported public keys in FIPS mode for client certificate authentication to current SSH server.

parameters.name: allowedMacs
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of supported MAC algorithms for current SSH server. The first one will be set as preferred MAC algorithm. This option is not honored when FIPS mode is enabled.

parameters.name: fipsAllowedMacs
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of supported MAC algorithms in FIPS mode for current SSH server.

parameters.name: nonSslListenerEnabled
parameters.description: AS2 non-SSL listener status.

parameters.name: nonSslListenerHost
parameters.description: AS2 non-SSL host

parameters.name: nonSslListenerPort
parameters.description: AS2 non-SSL port

parameters.name: sslListenerEnabled
parameters.description: AS2 SSL listener status

parameters.name: sslListenerHost
parameters.description: AS2 SSL host

parameters.name: sslListenerPort
parameters.description: AS2 SSL port

parameters.name: enabledCipherSuites
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of AS2 enabled ciphers.

parameters.name: fipsEnabledCipherSuites
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of AS2 enabled FIPS ciphers.

parameters.name: keyAlgorithm
parameters.description: AS2 key algorithm.

parameters.name: keyAlias
parameters.description: AS2 key alias

parameters.name: isReceiverEnabled
parameters.description: Whether AS2 receiving is enabled.

parameters.name: isPesitEnabled
parameters.description: PeSIT plain port enabled/disabled status

parameters.name: isPesitSslEnabled
parameters.description: PeSIT SSL port enabled/disabled status

parameters.name: isCftSslEnabled
parameters.description: PeSIT CFT SSL port enabled/disabled status

parameters.name: isPtcpEnabled
parameters.description: PeSIT over parallel-TCP plain port enabled/disabled status

parameters.name: isPtcpSslEnabled
parameters.description: PeSIT over parallel-TCP SSL port enabled/disabled status

parameters.name: pesitPort
parameters.description: PeSIT plain port

parameters.name: pesitSslPort
parameters.description: PeSIT SSL port (non CFT compatible)

parameters.name: cftSslPort
parameters.description: PeSIT CFT SSL port (CFT compatible)

parameters.name: ptcpPort
parameters.description: PeSIT over parallel-TCP plain port

parameters.name: ptcpSslPort
parameters.description: PeSIT over parallel-TCP SSL port

parameters.name: cftSslKeyAlgorithm
parameters.description: PeSIT CFT SSL key algorithm

parameters.name: cftSslKeyAlias
parameters.description: PeSIT CFT SSL key alias

parameters.name: cftSslProtocol
parameters.description: PeSIT CFT SSL protocol

parameters.name: cftSslTrustAlgorithm
parameters.description: PeSIT CFT SSL trust algorithm

parameters.name: ptcpKeyAlgorithm
parameters.description: PeSIT pTCP SSL key algorithm

parameters.name: ptcpKeyAlias
parameters.description: PeSIT pTCP SSL key alias

parameters.name: ptcpProtocol
parameters.description: PeSIT pTCP SSL protocol

parameters.name: ptcpTrustAlgorithm
parameters.description: PeSIT pTCP SSL trust algorithm

parameters.name: pesitKeyAlgorithm
parameters.description: PeSIT SSL key algorithm

parameters.name: pesitKeyAlias
parameters.description: PeSIT SSL key alias

parameters.name: pesitSslProtocol
parameters.description: PeSIT SSL protocol

parameters.name: pesitTrustAlgorithm
parameters.description: PeSIT SSL trust algorithm

parameters.name: autodetectTlsModeListenerEnabled
parameters.description: Whether the PeSIT autodetect TLS mode is enabled.

parameters.name: autodetectTlsModeListenerPort
parameters.description: The PeSIT autodetect TLS mode listener port.

parameters.name: autodetectTlsModeListenerKeyAlgorithm
parameters.description: The autodetect TLS mode listener key algorithm. Applicable for PeSIT.

parameters.name: autodetectTlsModeListenerKeyAlias
parameters.description: The autodetect TLS mode listener key alias. Applicable for PeSIT.

parameters.name: autodetectTlsModeListenerProtocol
parameters.description: The autodetect TLS mode listener protocol. Applicable for PeSIT.

parameters.description: Defines the first entry number of an ordered result to get; last entry number to return is (offset + limit - 1). Expects positive integer value. parameters.name: operation
parameters.description:
`test` - Test database configuration for main database or by component type.

`restart` - Restarts the database. Applicable only on MySQL and MariaDB.

`createPartitions` - Manually creates additional partitions in advance for the following days separately from the automated service. Applicable only on PostgreSQL.

`certificatesGeneration` - Generates embedded database certificates with a given validity (days). Applicable only on MariaDB with secure connection enabled.

`certificatesValidity` - Returns days, after which the embedded database certificates will expire. Applicable only on MariaDB.

parameters.description:
Number of partitions that will be created. Accepted range (3 to 365).

`Note` Used for `createPartitions` operation.

parameters.name: certificatesValidityPeriod
parameters.description:
Days for which the internalDB certificates will be valid.

`Note` Used for `certificatesGeneration` operation.

post.summary: Setup a new or existing account with certificates, transfer sites, transfer profiles and subscriptions.
post.description:
Setup a new or existing account with certificates, transfer sites, transfer profiles and subscriptions.
When the Content-Type and Accept headers are `multipart/mixed`, certificates can be imported from a file, in which they are separated
by a boundary and the following headers are specified for each file:

Content-Type: application/octet-stream

Content-Disposition: attachment;

keyname:<name specified in the respective certificate body>

encoded: false

**Note:** Due to an issue with the swagger schema, when importing certificates the json must also have a starting boundary and a Content-Type: application/json.

**Known issue:** The import of x509 certificates of local and private usage can not be done via text representation of the certificate, unless it is Base64 encoded (the 'encoded' header serves to show whether this is the case or not). If the encrypted certificate has not been encoded, it must be supplied in a PKCS #12 format file rather than plain text.

**Known issue:** Certificate import requires additional file with the certificate content because of swagger limitations (refer to https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-ui/issues/5090).

Get an account and its certificates, transfer sites, transfer profiles, routes and subscriptions.
When Accept header is set to `application/json`, only certificate properties would be returned.
When Accept header is set to `multipart/mixed`, certificates would be exported.

unlicensed.description: This property defines if the account is an unlicensed account.

isUnlicensedUserAllowedToReply.description: This property defines if the unlicensed user may reply to packages.

routingMode.description: Accounts support PeSIT Store and Forward mode via property named 'routingMode'. There are three possible options for the routingMode: accept (the value for Routing Mode that accept transfers), reject (the value for Routing Mode that reject transfers) and ignore (the value for Routing Mode that ignores transfers). By default is 'reject'.

name.description: The account name

homeFolder.description: The home folder on the local system used for this account. The folder path name must be a valid absolute directory name

type.description: The account type. Type 'user' means user account; type 'service' means service account; type 'template' means account template. Acts as a discriminator.

uid.description: The numeric user ID of the account. Required for SecureTransport installation running on UNIX environment.

gid.description: The numeric group ID of the account

enum: Axway Box and Stripe in Blue

notes.description: An unstructured comments to the account

lastModified.description: Last modified time for the account.

authByEmail.description: This property defines if authentication by email address is allowed for this account

disabled.description: This property defines if this account is disabled. If the account is disabled: 1) Subscriptions for the account will not trigger. ; 2) Users associated with the account will not be able to login and perform any transfers

transfersWebServiceAllowed.description: This property is an attribute name to indicate whether access to the transfers resource from the end user RESTful API is allowed.

pesitId.description: This property defines the PeSIT ID which is used for defining a PeSIT partnership.

loginRestrictionPolicy.description: The login restriction policy for this account.

transferType.description: This property is an attribute name to indicate the transfer type of the account's transfer site. It can be unspecified (N), internal (I), partner(E). By default is unspecified.

accountSubmitForApprove.description: If the account has been sent for approve to 'checker' administrator.

managedByCG.description: This property indicates whether the account is managed by Central Governance.

businessUnit.description: The business unit that account belongs to.

accountEncryptMode.description:
Account entities support repository encryption mode. There are two possible options for the encryptMode - 'ENABLED' and 'UNSPECIFIED'.
When 'ENABLED' is set then repository encryption for the account is enabled.
When 'UNSPECIFIED' is set then repository encryption for the account is not enabled and can be specified with EncryptClass.

subscriptionFolderDiscovery.description:
For accounts with multiple subscriptions, the number of subscriptions and the target folder depth would impact performance.
There are two possible options for the subscriptionFolderDiscovery - 'ITERATIVE' and 'RECURSIVE'.
When 'ITERATIVE' is set, then subscription folder discovery is performed by iteration over all of the account's subscriptions while trying to match the target folder. Should be used when the number of subscriptions is small and the target folder depth is large.
When 'RECURSIVE' is set, then subscription folder discovery is performed by recursive traversal of the target folder hierarchy - the target folder is checked first, then moving up to parent folders. Should be used when the number of subscriptions is large and the target folder depth is small.
The default value is 'ITERATIVE'.

fileArchivingPolicy.description:
Account entities support a custom property named 'fileArchivingPolicy' that can be set only if the global File Archiving is enabled.
There are three possible options for the fileArchivingPolicy - 'DEFAULT', 'DISABLED' and 'ENABLED'.
When 'DEFAULT' is set, then the following apply: if the account is assigned to business unit, it will inherit its policy, otherwise, the global archiving policy applies.
When 'DISABLED' is set, file archiving will be disabled for this account.
When 'ENABLED' is set, file archiving will be enabled for this account.

mappedUser.description: The name of the real user mapped to this account for SecureTransport installation running on Windows environment.

additionalAttributes.description:
Additional attributes which are defined with "key": "value" pairs. Keys should follow the pattern: [a-zA-Z0-9_.]+
and have length between 10 and 255 characters. Key should not start with "userVars.", since it is
a reserved word. Both key and value cannot be blank.

deliveryMethod.description: This property defines the delivery method. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Disabled' then Adhoc is disabled and enrollmentType/implicitEnrollmentType can not be set. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Default' then it is only available on BU and Account (setting the BU to use the value and account to use the BU value). When deliveryMethod is set to 'Anonymous' then implicit enrollment types 'Anonymous' and "" (empty string for Select by sender) are enabled. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Account Without Enrollment' then implicit enrollment types 'Anonymous', ""  (empty string for Select by sender) and 'Existing Account' are enabled. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Account With Enrollment' then implicit enrollment types 'Anonymous', "" (empty string for Select by sender), 'Enroll unlicensed', 'Enroll licensed' are enabled

enrollmentTypes.description: This property is used for a custom delivery method and can be set only if deliveryMethod property is set to 'Custom'

implicitEnrollmentType.description: The Implicit Enrollment Type value controls which option Web Access Plus selects initially in the User Access window and which enrollment type is used by the Axway Email Plug-ins. The choices depend on the enrollment types enabled by the Delivery Methods and Enrollment Types fields

warnNotified.description: Warning email notifications for future action.

accountDisabledDate.description: Date when account has been disabled by account retention maintenance.

accountNotified.description: Denotes whether an email has already been sent as a notification to the current account.

authExternal.description: Tells if external authentication is enabled. It has value 'true' if the user authentication is done by an external authentication and 'false' if the user authentication is done by the ST system

lastLogin.description: The time the user last successfully logged in. It has value null if the user never successfully logged in. The time is in RFC 2822 format - EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z. Note: This property is read only property. Secure Transport server sets that property on user login.

failedAuthMaximum.description: The number of failed authentication attempts allowed before authentication via the user is disabled. If not set, the value from configuration option Users.DefaultLockoutLimit will be taken. A value of 0 allows the user an unlimited number of attempts

failedSshKeyAuthMaximum.description: The number of failed ssh key authentication attempts allowed before authentication via the user is disabled. If not set, the value from configuration option Users.DefaultSshKeyLockoutLimit will be taken. A value of 0 allows the user an unlimited number of attempts

successfulAuthMaximum.description: The number of successful authentication attempts allowed within a predefined period before authentication is disabled. That period is defined globally. A value of null allows the user an unlimited number of attempts

lastFailedAuth.description: The time of the last unsuccessful authentication attempt. The time is in RFC 2822 format - EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z. Note: This property is read only property. Secure Transport server sets that property on failed user login.

lastFailedSshKeyAuth.description: The time of the last unsuccessful ssh key authentication attempt. The time is in RFC 2822 format - EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z. Note: This property is read only property. Secure Transport server sets that property on failed user login.

successfulLogins.description: The number of successful login attempts

password.description: The password. If the password property is not set then the passwordDigest property must be set and vice versa

passwordDigest.description: The password digest. If the passwordDigest property is not set then the password property must be set and vice versa

forcePasswordChange.description: Checks if password change is forced

lastPasswordChange.description: The last password change. The time is in RFC 2822 format - EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z. Note: This property is read only property. Secure Transport server sets that property on password change.

lastOwnPasswordChange.description: The last password change by the user. The time is in RFC 2822 format - EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z. Note: This property is read only property. Secure Transport server sets that property on password change by user.

passwordExpiryInterval.description: The password expiry interval. Accepts only positive integers.

secretAnswerGuessFailures.description: Failed attempts for guessing the secret answer.

forceSecretQuestionChange.description: Flag indicating if user is forced to set its secret question.
