value.description: The value to be used within the operations.

PatchDocument.description:
PATCH Method follows *RFC 6902* and covers 3 operation types - *add*, *remove* and *replace*.

**1. add**
The *add* operation is used in different ways depending on the target of the path being referenced.
Generally speaking we can use add to append to a list, add a member to an object or update the value of an existing field.
The add operation accepts a value member which is the value to update the referenced path.

- If the target location specifies an array index or -, a new value is
inserted into the array at the specified index or in the end of the array where order does not matter.

**Note:** Some objects are being listed in the order they were persisted in the database, despite the patch operation placing it at the correct position.
- If the target location specifies an object member that does not
already exist, a new member is added to the object. If this member is invalid,
it would be ignored and would not be created.
- If the target location specifies an object member that does exist, that member is completely updated.

**2. remove**
The *remove* operation removes the value at the target location. The target location MUST exist for the operation to be successful.

**3. replace**
The *replace* operation replaces the value at the target location with a new value.  The operation object MUST contain a "value" member
whose content specifies the replacement value. The target location MUST exist for the operation to be successful.
- If the target location specifies an array index, the object at that index would be modified,
but the array elements could be in different order on next GET request.

serverEnabled.description: Choose whether or not ICAP server to be enabled

name.description: The name of the ICAP server

type.description: The type of the ICAP server: INCOMING, OUTGOING or BOTH. INCOMING means that scanning will be performed by this ICAP server for all Incoming transfers: File upload, AdHoc message creation, etc. OUTGOING means that scanning will be performed by this ICAP server for all Outgoing transfers: File download, Reading of an AdHoc message, etc. BOTH means that scanning will be performed by this ICAP server for all types of transfers

url.description: The ICAP server URL in the following format: icap://dlpav-address:port/servicename. The 'servicename' could be the same as the mode of operation - REQMOD or RESPMOD, or it could be something custom and vendor specific. Examples: icap://dlpav-address:1344/AVSCAN, icap://dlpav-address:1344/REQMOD, icap://dlpav-address:11344/RESPMOD

maxSize.description: Message maximum file size in MB to be sent to the ICAP server. If max message size is set to 0 or negative value, it is considered unlimited

previewSize.description: Preview size in KB. If it is set to 0 or negative value, the whole file is transfered to the ICAP server, otherwise the specified size of the file is sent first. Based on the result of the preview, the scan is either complete or the rest of the file is sent for scan as well.

connectionSecure.description: Indicates if ICAP server should use secure connection

verifyCertificate.description: Indicates if server certificates should be verified or not.

clientCertificate.description: ID of local certificate to be used for authentication.

fipsEnabled.description: Indicates whether or not FIPS transfer mode should be used.

denyOnConnectionError.description: Indicates whether or not to deny the transfer on connection failure

notifyOnIcapError.description: Indicates whether or not to enable email notifications on connection failure

mailAddressesOnIcapError.description: List of addresses to which email notifications must be sent in case of connection failure

notifyOnIcapDenied.description: Indicates whether or not to enable email notifications on ICAP denied

mailAddressesOnIcapDenied.description: List of addresses to which email notifications must be sent in case of ICAP deny

includeFilename.description: Indicates whether to report the absolute path to the transferred file inside the ICAP request

policyExpression.description: The field allows the usage of ST Expression Language. Based on this expression scanning will be performed or not. Example: ${env['DXAGENT_PROTOCOL'] ne 'ssh'}. Translation: Do not scan if the transfer is taking place over SSH protocol

onlyIfPartnerRecipient.description: Enables or disables ICAP scanning for AdHoc messages if at least one of the recipients is partner. User type - internal or partner - is controlled by the account setting. Possible values are 'Internal' - internal accounts - and 'Partner' - external accounts. If the type of a recipient cannot be identified, the account will be considered External.

withoutBU.description: Indicates whether or not to enable ICAP scanning for accounts with no Business Unit assigned

ignoredFileType.description: List of file extensions separated by comma. Files with these extensions will not be scanned

headersMapping.description: A list of semicolon separated key-value pairs of custom HTTP headers in the following format: 'key=value'. The separator sign '=' is mandatory.

connectionTimeout.description: Indicates maximum connection tiomeout in seconds

retryAttempts.description: Indicates maximum retry attempts in case of a connection failure. The value should be a non-negative one.

retryDelay.description: Indicates the delay between retry attempts in seconds. The value should be a non-negative one.

enabledCiphers.description: A list of comma separated ciphers to be used for SSL connection. The default value is: TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256, TLS_AES_128_CCM_SHA256, TLS_AES_128_CCM_8_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_DHE_DSS_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256

enabledProtocols.description: A list of comma separated SSL protocols to be enabled. The default value is: TLSv1.2, TLSv1.3

enableWinNtFormat.description: Indicates whether or not to report X-Authenticated-User in WinNT format in case of LDAP authentication.

stopTransfersModifyOrNotHandled.description: Indicates whether or not to stop the transfer if ICAP server returns a MODIFY result or an unhandled status

treatModifyAsBlock.description: Indicates whether or not to treat the ICAP MODIFIED action as block

id.description: The id of the ldap domain.

name.description: The name of the ldap domain.

isDefault.description: Specify if ldap doamin is default domain.

sslEnabled.description: Whether ssl is enabled for ldap domain.

tlsEnabled.description: Whether tls is enabled for ldap domain.

bindDnPassword.description: Bind dn password of ldap domain.

commonCase.description: Common case property of ldap domain.

clientCertificate.description: ID of a local certificate to be used for authentication.

shouldUseOnlyAdditionalQuery.description: Whether to use only additional query.

useGenericSearchFilter.description: Whether to use generic search filter.

port.description: The port of ldap server.

enabled.description: Whether attribute is enabled for address book.

mappedAttribute.description: The mapped attribute for address book.

userClass.description: User class property of dn filter.

AccountFilePurgeApplication.description: A representation of a File Maintenance application.

deleteFilesDays.description: This property represents file retention period. All files older than the property value will be deleted.

pattern.description: This property represents file name pattern. All file names match of the property value will be regarded by the application.

expirationPeriod.description: If this property is set to true, the deletion of files based on file expiration period will be enabled. The file expiration period will be set as flow file attribute EXPIRE.ON.

removeFolders.description: If this property is set to true, the deletion of folders remain empty after File Maintence will be enabled.

warningNotifications.description: If this property is set to true, the warning notifications feature will be enabled.

notifyDays.description: This property represents warning notifications period when emails will be sent to the recipients. Accept comma-separated values.

sendSentinelAlert.description: If this property is set to true, the warning TO_BE_DELETED state will be reported to Sentinel Server.

warnNotifyAccount.description: If this property is set to true, the warning notifications will be sent to account email.

warningNotificationsTemplate.description: The email template name which will be used in File Maintenance warning email notifications.

warnNotifyEmails.description: This property represents comma-separated email addresses for warning notifications recipients.

deletionNotifications.description: If this property is set to true, the deletion notifications feature will be enabled.

deletionNotificationsTemplate.description: The email template name which will be used in File Maintenance report email notifications.

deletionNotifyAccount.description: If this property is set to true, the deletion notifications will be sent to account email.

deletionNotifyEmails.description: This property represents comma-separated email addresses for deletion notifications recipients.

enableAccountNotifications.description: If the account matches a criteria and an action to be performed in X days or sooner, a notification mail should be sent to the email address configured for that user. Accepts "on" value to enable the notifications.

passwordNotificationDays.description: The comma-separated periods for the account password expiration notifications.

notificationCertificateEmails.description: The comma-separated email addresses for the account certificates exipration notifications.

timeKeepingDataInDb.description: Specify how old log entries will be when they are deleted in terms of days, hours, or minutes. You cannot enter spaces-only values in this field.

recordsPerFile.description: Specify the maximum number of records that can exist in an exported file. When this value is exceeded, SecureTransport starts to export the server log entries in a new file.

exportEnabled.description: Whether export is enabled. Applicable only for Oracle.

parallelismDegree.description: Number of processors to use for export. Applicable only for Oracle.

outboxEnabled.description: [Allow Subscribers to Submit files in this Application] When this property is set to true then permit incoming file transfers from the subscriber parties to the application and following properties can be set: OUTBOX_FOLDER, SECURE_CONNECTION_REQUIRED, RENAME_FILES and OUTGOING_FILENAME_FORMAT

outboxFolder.description: The name of the folder where incoming transferred files are submitted via subscriptions

secureConnectionRequired.description: Define whether to enable SSL for the incoming transfers

renameFilesEnabled.description: Define whether to add a prefix to the file name identifying the sender before it is sent to the internal system

outboxFileFormat.description: The format of the new file name. By default, the file is renamed in the format <ID>\_<FILENAME> where, <ID> is the Subscriber ID specified when the subscription is created, <FILENAME> is the original name of the transferred file and "\_" is the delimiter. The use of the placeholders, <ID>,<FILENAME> and the delimiter in the new file name format is mandatory

inboxEnabled.description: [Send files to Subscribers] When this property is set to true then permit outgoing file transfers from the application to the subscribed parties. The properties INBOX_FOLDER and ID_FROM_FILENAME_EXTRACTION_PATTERN can be set

inboxFolder.description: [Receive folder] The name of the folder where outgoing transferred files are submitted to the subscriber. The receive folder is created as a sub-folder of the subscription folder

inboxIdPattern.description: A pattern in the ID Pattern box to define the ID of the subscriber to whom files are routed. By default, the pattern is <ID>\_<FILENAME> where, <ID> is a regular expression corresponding to the Subscriber ID specified when the subscription is created, <FILENAME> is the original name of the transferred file and and "\_" is the delimiter. The use of the placeholders, <ID>,<FILENAME> and the delimiter in the new file name format is mandatory.

name.description: The unique name of the business unit entity.

baseFolder.description: The base folder of the business unit entity.

parent.description: The name of the parent business unit entity.

businessUnitHierarchy.description: The full path hierarchy of the business unit entity.

baseFolderModifyingAllowed.description: Flag indicating if the base folder of the business unit entity is modifiable (this property defines whether the base folder for the belonging accounts may be modified).

dmz.description: The name of the DMZ zone

managedByCG.description: This property indicates whether the business unit is managed by Central Governance.

enabledIcapServers.description: Enabled icap servers of the business unit.

additionalAttributes.description:
Additional attributes which are defined with "key": "value" pairs. Keys must start with "userVars." prefix, follow the pattern: [a-zA-Z0-9_.]+
and have length between 10 and 255 characters (including the prefix). Non prefixed part of key should not start with "userVars.", since it is
a reserved word. Both key and value cannot be blank.

sharedFoldersCollaborationAllowed.description: Flag indicating if accounts may collaborate using, creating and sharing folders.

notifyEmails.description: The comma-separated email addresses for Account Maintenance notifications.
The comma-separated email addresses for Account Maintenance notifications.

isAllowedForModifying.description: Flag indicating if the HTML Template folder may be modified

isWebServiceRightsModifyingAllowed.description: Flag indicating if web services rights are allowed for modifying

transfersWebServiceAllowed.description: Defines whether the access to the /transfers resource from the End-user REST API is allowed

policy.description: Defines whether the child business units are allowed to modify archiving policy

policyModifyingAllowed.description: Defines whether the child business units are allowed to modify archiving policy.

folderPolicy.description: Defines whether account under BU can modify folder.

customFolder.description: Custom archiving folder of the business unit

encryptionCertificatePolicy.description: Archiving certificate policy of the business unit.

customEncryptionCertificate.description: Custom encryption certificate of the business unit.

customFileSizePolicy.description: Custom file size policy of the business unit.

customFileSize.description: Custom file size for archiving of the businessunit unit.

isPolicyModifyingAllowed.description: Flag indicating whether the login restriction policy option is modifiable on account level.

policy.description: The login restriction policy for this business unit.

modifySourcesAllowed.description: If sources are allowed for modifying.

modifyCollaborationAllowed.description: Defines whether the Shared Folders collaboration is enabled for the business unit successors.

allowPolicyModifying.description: This property defines whether the modification of File Maintenance settings at account level is enabled/disabled.

warnNotifyEmails.description: This property represents comma-separated email addresses for warning notifications recipients.

deletionNotifyEmails.description: This property represents comma-separated email addresses for deletion notifications recipients.

PrivateCertificate.description: A representation of a private certificate.

id.description: The ID of the certificate entity.

name.description: The name of the certificate.

subject.description: The the certificate subject DN (distinguished name) in RFC2253 format. Example: 'CN=test,OU=Axway_TT,O=Axway,L=Sofia,ST=Sofia,C=Bulgaria'.

type.description: The type of the certificate entity as string.

usage.description: The usage of the certificate entity as string.

expirationTime.description: The certificate expiration time in Unix Timestamp format. This is a read only property and it is automatically calculated depending on the 'validityPeriod' property

creationTime.description: The creation time of the certificate entity in Unix Timestamp format.

signAlgorithm.description: The certificate signature algorithm as string

keySize.description: The size of the key. Valid values are: 1024, 2048, 3072, 4096.

keyAlgorithm.description: The name of the algorithm for generated key. Only for certificate entities of type 'pgp' this property can be set (for certificate entities of type 'x509' this property is automatically being set to 'RSA' when generate a 'x509' certificate.

issuer.description: The issuer of the certificate. This is a auto generating read only property.

serialNumber.description: The serial number. This is a auto generating read only property.

fingerprint.description: The certificate fingerprint. This is a auto generating read only property.

accessLevel.description: The access level to this certificate for other accounts.

overwrite.description: Define whether to overwrite the certificate if a certificate with the same name, type and usage already exists.

caPassword.description: The password of the CA for the certificate generation.

exportPrivateKey.description: Define whether to export the private key or not.

exportSSHPublicKey.description: Define whether to export the SSH public key or not.

additionalAttributes.description:
Additional attributes which are defined with "key": "value" pairs. Keys must start with "userVars." prefix, follow the pattern: [a-zA-Z0-9_.]+
and have length between 10 and 255 characters (including the prefix). Non prefixed part of key should not start with "userVars.", since it is
a reserved word. Both key and value cannot be blank.

LocalCertificate.description: A representation of a local certificate.

PartnerCertificate.description: A representation of a partner certificate.

LoginCertificate.description: A representation of a login certificate.

TrustedCertificate.description: A representation of a trusted certificate.

subject.description: The the certificate subject DN (distinguished name) in RFC2253 format. Example: 'CN=test,OU=Axway_TT,O=Axway,L=Sofia,ST=Sofia,C=Bulgaria'.

keySize.description: The size of the key. Valid values are: 1024, 2048, 3072, 4096.

signAlgorithm.description: The certificate signature algorithm as string.

name.description: The name of the DMZ zone. Zone name can not contain characters "\", "/", ";" and "'"

publicURLPrefix.description: The public URL prefix for public access to the DMZ via HTTP(s).

ssoSpEntityId.description: The SSO Service Provider EntityId to identify to an Identity Provider.

isDnsResolutionEnabled.description: Define whether DNS resolution on Edge is enabled or not (true if DNS resolution on Edge is enabled and false-otherwise).

isDefault.description: Define whether the DMZ zone is set to default or not.

title.description: Title of the DMZ edge. Edge title can not contain characters "\", "/", ";" and "'"

deploymentSite.description: The cluster deployment site of the edge

enabledProxy.description: Check status of the proxy whether it is enabled/disabled (true if proxy is enabled, false otherwise)

isAutoDiscoverable.description:
**Note:** Beta Feature - Do not use in Production. Check 'Beta.Dmz.DynamicNodeIpDiscovery.Enabled' configuration option.
**Note:** The property is available only for zones different than the 'Private' one and only on Backend.

Check whether the zone type is auto-discoverable or static (true if zone is auto-discoverable, false - if static).

dynamicNodeIpDiscoveryFqdn.description:
**Note:** Beta Feature - Do not use in Production. Check 'Beta.Dmz.DynamicNodeIpDiscovery.Enabled' configuration option.
**Note:** The property is available only for zones different than the 'Private' one and only on Backend.

Fqdn to be used for resolving multiple node addresses.

ipAddresses.description: IP addresses for the DMZ edge

descriptor.description: The unique identifier for current node (IP or hostname ..etc).

streamingProtocol.description: The streaming protocol for DMZ edge

port.description: The number of port for DMZ edge on the current protocol

isEnabled.description: Define whether the protocol is enabled to be used from the edge

sslAlias.description: Certificate reference for DMZ edge on the current protocol.

port.description: The number of port for the proxi

isEnabled.description: Define whether the proxy is enabled

username.description: The user name to authenticate to the proxy

isUsePassword.description: Shows if the password should be preserved/overwritten or removed (true if the password should be preserved/overwritten with non empty one and false when the password should be removed)

password.description: The password for the edge proxy. Password can be set only if 'isUsePassword' is set to 'true'. This property can not be get via the ST REST API.

ipAddress.description: The IP address for DMZ edge.

name.description: The name of the login restriction policy. The name can not contain characters "/", ";" and "'".

type.description: The type of the login restriction policy.

description.description: The description of the login restriction policy.

businessUnits.description: Names of business units that are assigned to the login restriction policy to.

additionalAttributes.description:
Additional attributes which are defined with "key": "value" pairs. Keys must start with "userVars." prefix, follow the pattern: [a-zA-Z0-9_.]+
and have length between 10 and 255 characters (including the prefix). Non prefixed part of key should not start with "userVars.", since it is
a reserved word. Both key and value cannot be blank.

isDefault.description: Define whether the policy is the default one for the ST server.

id.description: The id of the login restriction rule.

name.description: The name of the login restriction rule. The name can not contain characters "/", ";" and "'".

isEnabled.description: Define whether the rule should be enabled (true)or disabled (false). Each rule may be temporarily disabled and in that case it will not be used until it is enabled again.

type.description: The type of the login restriction rule. The type could be either `ALLOW` and defines a condition (IP and/or expression) to allow login or could be `DENY` and defines a condition (IP and/or expression) to deny login. The rules of the same type are always evaluated as one set of rules - the order is not significant. But the order of evaluation 'AllOW' and 'DENY' sets, depend on the type of the policy they belong to.

clientAddress.description:
The client address for the login restriction rule. When the current rule is evaluated it is compared with this client address. If there is no match then the rule is assumed to not match. If the current client address matches to the one defined in the rule and any additional conditions defined in the rule(for example expressions) also match (all of them) then the rule is assumed to match to the current user connection and is applied. 

The value of the client address could be one of:
  - Specific IPv4 address
  - Specific IPv6 address
  - Specific IPv4 address combined with a network mask. Example: 172.23.34.0/24
  - Specific IPv6 address combined with a network mask. Example: FC00:1234:56::/120
  - Specific fully qualified host name. Example: host.domain.com
  - Specific fully qualified host name, which is allowed to contain the * wildcard character. Example: *.domain.com

expression.description: The expression that should be evaluated to true in order for the rule to apply. This expression should be in the form of the SecureTransport expression language. It may include any environment variables, session attributes or other elements which are available at login time. For example it may include expression which evaluates the user class of the current user and compares it with some value. This expression may be not set - empty string or null value, in which case it would not be taken into account (cosider it true).

description.description: The description of a login restriction rule.

id.description: The id of the audit log entity

dateModified.description: The modification date of the audit log entity

configurationId.description: The configuration id of the node

operationType.description: The type of the operation logged with the audit log entity

objectType.description: The type of the object for which audit log entity is added

objectIdentifier.description: The id of the audited object

objectName.description: The name of the audited object

objectString.description: The string representation of the audited object

userName.description: The name of the user who did the operation audited

remoteAddress.description: The IP address of the remote client that sent the request

time.description: The time of the log in RFC 2822 format - EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z. Note: This property is read only property.

secure.description: Defines whether the transfer occurred over secure connection

account.description: The name of the account that performed the transfer

login.description: The user login name used for this transfer

serverName.description: The name of the server processing the transfer

incoming.description: Define whether the transfer direction is incoming or outgoing

serverInitiated.description: Defines whether the transfer is server or client initiated

filename.description: The name of the transferred file

localFilename.description: The local name of the transferred file

protocol.description: The protocol used to transfer the file

duration.description: Defines the time when transfer is finished

operationIndex.description: The operation index of the transfer. It could be '(none)' or some ID.

remotePartner.description: Remote partner that gets/sends the file.

coreId.description: The core id of the transfer

cycleId.description: The sentinel cycle id for the transfer

securityParameters.description: Negotiated during handshake session security parameters.

transferProfile.description: Transfer profile of the site(PeSIT related).

name.description: Name of the transfer site

startTime.description: The time when the transfer started

account.description: The name of the account that performed the transfer

login.description: The user login name used for this transfer

userClass.description: The user class. By default the user class can be `VirtClass` or `RealClass`

transferProfile.description: Transfer profile of the site(PeSIT related).

localFilename.description: The local name of the transferred file

serverName.description: The name of the listener processing the transfer

size.description: The size of the transferred file

remotePartner.description: Remote partner that gets/sends the file.

sessionId.description: The session ID of the transfer

archivedAs.description: The name under which the transferred file is archived

coreId.description: The core id of the transfer

cycleId.description: The sentinel cycle id for the transfer

securityParameters.description: Negotiated during handshake session security parameters.

requestEntity.description: Representation of the rest api call that initiated the transfer(if submitted through the ST RESTful API).

additionalInformation.description: The additional information related to this transfer.

result.description: The result of the operation (usually a filename)

startTime.description: The time when the transfer started

type.description: Type of the data

receipt.description: Defines whether the data is a receipt or not. If it is true, then this data represents mdn.

status.description: The overall status of the transfer.

name.description: The unique name of the mail template.

description.description: The description of the mail template

roleName.description: The role name of the administrator

isLimited.description: The role type of the administrator - limited (delegated) or master

localAuthentication.description: Clarifies whether the administator is being authenticated by ST or external service.

certificateDN.description: Specifies the DN of the certificate used by the administrator for authentication.

dualAuthentication.description: Clarifies whether the administator is being authenticated with password and certificate or with password only.

locked.description: Clarifies whether the administator is enabled/active.

parent.description: Specifies the name of the parent administrator of this administrator in an administrator hierarchy.

fullCreationPath.description: Specifies the path of descendands of this administrator in an administrator hierarchy.

businessUnits.description: Collection with the names of the business units assigned to a delegated administrator.

passwordExpired.description: Clarifies whether the administator's password is expired.

lastPasswordChangeTime.description: Last time the administrator's password was changed

lastOwnPasswordChange.description: Last time the administrator has changed their own password

loginFailureCount.description: The count of the login failures

lastLoginTime.description: Last login time of the administrator

lastFailureLoginTime.description: Last failure login time of the administrator

canReadOnly.description: Defines if the administrator is read only

isMaker.description: Defines if the administrator has Maker rights

isChecker.description: Defines if the administrator has Checker rights

canCreateUsers.description: Defines if the administrator can create users

canUpdateUsers.description: Defines if the administrator can update users

canAccessHelpDesk.description: Defines if the administrator can access help desk

canSeeFullAuditLog.description: Defines if the administrator can access the Audit Log

canManageAdministrators.description: Defines if the administrator can manage administrators

canManageApplications.description: Defines if the administrator can manage applications

canManageSharedFolders.description: Defines if the administrator can manage shared folders

canManageBusinessUnits.description: Defines if the administrator can manage business units

canManageRouteTemplates.description: Defines if the administrator can manage route templates

canManageExternalScriptStep.description: Defines if the administrator can manage the external script step.

canManageLoginRestrictionPolicies.description: Defines if the administrator can manage the login restriction policies.

canManageIcapSettings.description: Defines if the administrator can manage the ICAP settings.

canManageExternalScriptRootExecution.description: Defines if the administrator can manage external script root execution.

AdministratorRights.description:
A set of permissions, defining what type of operations a certain Delegated Administrator is able to perform.
**Note:** Only applicable for Delegated Administrators, hence it`s values are not to be taken into account for Master Administrators.

value.description: The value to be used within the operations.

charsets.description: Collection of all supported charsets in the ST server.

name.description: Route name

type.description: Route types: TEMPLATE - Route Package Template, SIMPLE - Route in a Route Package Template, COMPOSITE - Assign a route with TEMPLATE type to a virtual account and its subscriptions

managedByCG.description: This property indicates whether the route is managed by Central Governance.

routeTemplate.description: In COMPOSITE route this is the id of an existing template route visible by the account this route is created for

account.description: The account where the route is subscribed

businessUnits.description: Route business unit names appropriate for the Administrator who is managing this route

conditionType.description:
For routes of type TEMPLATE or COMPOSITE, the property determines whether all SIMPLE routes that
match their conditions will be executed or just the first one.

For routes of type SIMPLE, the property determines if the route gets executed always or based on the condition,
specified in the condition property using expression language.

condition.description: An expression for route execution when conditionType is EL.

failureEmailNotification.description: Notify following e-mails on route failure.

failureEmailTemplate.description: Notification template name on route failure

successEmailNotification.description: Notify following e-mails on route success.

successEmailTemplate.description: Notification template name on route success

triggeringEmailNotification.description: Notify following e-mails on route triggering.

triggeringEmailTemplate.description: Notification template name on route triggering

subscriptions.description: Collection of subscription IDs for an account

additionalAttributes.description:
Additional attributes which are defined with "key": "value" pairs. Keys must start with "userVars." prefix, follow the pattern: [a-zA-Z0-9_.]+
and have length between 10 and 255 characters (including the prefix). Non prefixed part of key should not start with "userVars.", since it is
a reserved word. Both key and value cannot be blank.

RouteStepEncodingConversion.description: A representation of a route step of type EncodingConversion

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property.

outputCharset.description: Specify output file encoding. If not specified, source file encoding is used.

type.description: Route step type. ExecuteRoute step links the routes of type TEMPLATE and SIMPLE. The next steps are used with SIMPLE route type.

conditionType.description: Defines whether the step is executed always or based on a condition, specified in the condition property using expression language.

condition.description: An expression for step execution when conditionType is EL.

actionOnStepSuccess.description: Action on step success. Defines if the route will continue after the step success.

actionOnStepFailure.description: Action on step failure. If set to PROCEED, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

RouteStepCompress.description: A representation of a route step of type Compress

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property.

zipPassword.description: Zip file password. Used with compression type ZIP only.

singleArchiveName.description: Archive name or expression. Not used with compression type GZIP. Example: archive-${timestamp}.zip.

postTransformationActionRenameAsExpressi.description: Post transformation action rename expression for compress step.

RouteStepDecompress.description: A representation of a route step of type Decompress

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property.

zipPassword.description: Zip file password. Do not use the property if it is not needed in the step flow.

postTransformationActionRenameAsExpressi.description: Post transformation action rename expression for decompress step.

RouteStepLineFolding.description: A representation of a route step of type LineFolding

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property.

fileFoldWidth.description: Maximum lane width in the file over which point it will be folded. A positive integer value.

inputCharset.description: Specify the source file encoding. Example: UTF-8

outputCharset.description: Specify output file encoding. If not specified, source file encoding is used.

postTransformationActionRenameAsExpressi.description: Post transformation action rename expression for line folding step.

RouteStepLineEnding.description: A representation of a route step of type LineEnding

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property.

inputCharset.description: Specify the source file encoding. Example: UTF-8 \n

outputCharset.description: Specify output file encoding. If not specified, source file encoding is used.

postTransformationActionRenameAsExpressi.description: Post transformation action rename expression for line ending step.

RouteStepLinePadding.description: A representation of a route step of type LinePadding

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property.

linePaddingCharacter.description: Specify line padding character as valid Unicode escape sequence. Example : \u0043

inputCharset.description: Specify the source file encoding. Example: UTF-8

outputCharset.description: Specify output file encoding. If not specified, source file encoding is used

postTransformationActionRenameAsExpressi.description: Post transformation action rename expression for line padding step.

RouteStepLineTruncating.description: A representation of a route step of type LineTruncating

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property.

inputCharset.description: Specify the source file encoding. Example: UTF-8

outputCharset.description: Specify output file encoding. If not specified, source file encoding is used.

truncateLength.description: Line Truncate trims the file lines to have a limited maximum length. Use this setting to specify the lines maximum length in number of characters/symbols. This will cause extra characters to be discarded.

postTransformationActionRenameAsExpressi.description: Post transformation action rename expression for line truncating step.

RouteStepPgpDecryption.description: A representation of a route step of type PgpDecryption. PGP private keys will be automatically determined on runtime. They will be searched only within the key store of the account subscribed to this route.

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property.

postTransformationActionRenameAsExpressi.description: Post transformation action rename expression for step.

RouteStepPgpEncryption.description: A representation of a route step of type PgpEncryption.

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property.

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

encryptKeyOwnerExpression.description: You can specify either an account name or use an EL expression to determine the recipient based on the environment information (such as filename). If an account name is unknown (e.g. expression based) its PGP certificates will be determined on runtime. PGP certificates can be expression based as well. All the encrypt key related properties (expressions, owners, types) should be set if an encrypt key is used. Encrypt or sign key usage is mandatory.

encryptKeyExpression.description: PGP encryption name amongst PGP Public Keys (within the selected above account) or by entering an expression for this. Wild card symbols ( asterisk symbol and ?) can also be used when specifying the PGP key alias. If multiple keys match the pattern the first one will be picked up and used.

signKeyOwnerExpression.description: You can specify either an account name or use an EL expression to determine the recipient based on the environment information (such as filename). If an account name is unknown (e.g. expression based) its PGP certificates will be determined on runtime. PGP certificates can be expression based as well. All the sign key related properties (expressions, owners, types) should be set if a sign key is used.

signKeyExpression.description: PGP encryption name amongst PGP Public Keys (within the selected above account) or by entering an expression for this. Wild card symbols ( asterisk symbol and ?) can also be used when specifying the PGP key alias. If multiple keys match the pattern the first one will be picked up and used.

compressionType.description: Numbers in string format used "0" - no compression, "-1" - use preferred, "1" - ZIP, "2" - ZLIB, "3" - BZIP2

compressionLevel.description: The values are 2 for FAST, 5 for NORMAL, 7 for GOOD, 9 for BEST

postTransformationActionRenameAsExpressi.description: Post transformation action rename expression for step.

RouteStepRename.description: A representation of a route step of type Rename

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails

outputFileName.description: Output file name or expression. Example: ${basename(currentfulltarget)}.transformed

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property

RouteStepCharactersReplace.description: A representation of a route step of type CharactersReplace

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property.

lineStrip.description: Line strip enablement. Use value "stripEnabled" to enable line strip. Other value will disable the line strip.

replaceCharacterSequence.description: Specify replace character sequence. Unicode notation (\uXXXX) can be used. Multiple replace character sequences separated with a comma (,) can be specified. Comma must be Unicode encoded (\002c) if used in the replace sequence.

inputCharset.description: Specify the source file encoding. Example: UTF-8

outputCharset.description: Specify output file encoding. If not specified, source file encoding is used.

postTransformationActionRenameAsExpressi.description: Post transformation action rename expression for step.

RouteStepExternalScript.description: A representation of a route step of type ExternalScript

scriptPath.description: String or expression with an absolute path to external script. Example: For Unix environment: /usr /bin/env bash -c ${FILEDRIVEHOME}/bin/agents/example.sh For Windows environment: cmd /c ${FILEDRIVEHOME}\bin\agents\example.bat

logOutput.description: The script will genarate standard output to Server log.

rootExecution.description: Root execution property for external script.

RouteStepPublish.description: A representation of a route step of type Publish

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property.

targetAccountExpressionType.description: Target account name or expression will be used.

targetFolderExpression.description: Folder in the account to publish the file to. Not existing folder will be automatically created. You can specify either a folder name or use an EL expression to determine the folder based on the environment information

targetFolderExpressionType.description: Target folder simple name or expression will be used.

publishFileAs.description: New file name or expression for a new file name.

triggerSubscription.description: When 'true', file published to a subscription folder triggers the subscription folder. Set to 'false' if you do not want any actions to be triggered as part of the publish operations (e.g. when publishing to the same subscription the file was picked up from)

disableAutoCreateTargetFolder.description: Disable auto create target folder for step.

postRoutingActionRenameExpression.description: Post transformation action rename expression for step.

RouteStepSendToPartner.description: A representation of a route step of type SendToPartner

usePrecedingStepFiles.description: If true, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails

fileFilterExpression.description: File name or file name expression. It is used with the file filter expression property.

transferSiteExpression.description: This value should be specified as concatenation of transfer sites or expressions with a separator "#!#CVD#!#". Examples - transfer_site_name#!#CVD#!#, transfer_site_name1#!#CVD#!#transfer_site_name2#!#CVD#!#, transfer_site_name_expression#!#CVD#!#

transferSiteExpressionType.description: Specifies whether a list of site names or an expression will be used for the transferSiteExpression parameter.

uploadFolder.description: You can specify an upload folder that will overwrite the one configured in the transfer site settings (if allowed with the respective transfer site). Expression language can be used to specify the new upload folder.

transferProfileExpression.description: Transfer profile property is used only if the transfer site is of type PeSIT. Otherwise it will be ignored. When the transfer profile is specified by using Expression Language, there are 3 possible cases: (1) EL expression does not match any account transfer profiles - then the default transfer profile is used. (2) EL expression matches more than one transfer profile - then the default transfer profile is used. (3) EL expression matches exactly one transfer profile - the matched transfer profile is used.

storeAndForwardMode.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. All the advanced PeSIT settings are included or all are ommitted. "Preserve" Store and Forward mode will preserve the current Store and Forward transfer (if any). "Start new" will initiate a new Store and Forward transfer and the current transfer (if any) will be acknowledged.

virtualFilename.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. Use this field to override the virtual file name (PI12) predefined in the transfer profile. To preserve it use ${pesit.pi.fileName}. This configuration parameter corresponds to the idf parameter in Axway Transfer CFT.

recordFormat.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. "Variable", "Fixed". Use this field to override the record format (PI31) predefined in the transfer profile. To preserve it use ${pesit.pi.recordFormat}. This configuration parameter corresponds to the frecfm parameter in Axway Transfer CFT.

recordLength.description: Use this field to override the record length (PI32) predefined in the transfer profile. To preserve it use ${pesit.pi.recordLength}. This configuration parameter corresponds to the frecl parameter in Axway Transfer CFT.

fileLabel.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. Use this field to override the file label (PI37) predefined in the transfer profile. To preserve it use ${pesit.pi.fileLabel}. This configuration parameter corresponds to the nfname parameter in Axway Transfer CFT.

originator.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. Use this field to override the original sender (PI61) of the transfer. To preserve the original value use ${pesit.pi.originalSenderID}.

finalDestination.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. Use this field to override the final destination (PI62) of the transfer. To preserve the original value use ${pesit.pi.finalDestinationID}. To make a Store and Forward PeSIT transfer specify the final destination and choose the intermediate partner (ipart parameter in Axway Transfer CFT) in the transfer site list.

userMessage.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. The Last PeSIT specific setting. Use this field to override the user message (PI99) predefined in the PeSIT transfer site. To preserve use ${pesit.pi.serviceParam}. This configuration parameter corresponds to the parm parameter in Axway Transfer CFT.

triggerFileName.description: Name of the trigger file to be sent to the transfer site after successful routing of file(s). EL expressions are supported.

triggerTargetAccountExpression.description: An account name, login name or use an expression to determine the recipient based on the environment information.

triggerTransferSiteExpression.description: Transfer sites to send trigger files to. Expression language is supported. This value must be a concatenation of trigger transfer sites or expressions  with a separator "#!#CVD#!#". Examples - transfer_site_name#!#CVD#!#, transfer_site_name1#!#CVD#!#transfer_site_name2#!#CVD#!#, transfer_site_name_expression#!#CVD#!#

triggerTransferSiteExpressionType.description: Transfer site expression type for the trigger output file.

triggerFileContent.description: The content of the trigger file. Expression language is supported. This value should be specified as concatenation of lines of the trigger file with a separator "#!#CVD#!#". Examples - line#!#CVD#!#, line1#!#CVD#!#line2#!#CVD#!#, line_expression#!#CVD#!#, null value or #!#CVD#!# for empty (zero byte) trigger file.

postRoutingActionType.description: Post routing action types: NONE, DELETE, RENAME. Default is no action (NONE).

sleepIncrementBetweenRetries.description: Time (in milliseconds) with which the sleep interval between retries will be increased after each retry.

sleepBetweenRetries.description: Time interval (in milliseconds) which will be awaited between retries.

maxParallelClients.description: Maximum number of transfers that will be executed in parallel by the step.

maxNumberOfRetries.description: Number of times each transfer will be retried if it fails. The retries are executed synchronously and the step will not finish execution until all files are sent successfully or the retry count configured in this property is reached.

triggerFileForEach.description: Trigger file output for each transferred file.

triggerTransferProfileExpression.description: Transfer profile property is used only if the transfer site is of type PeSIT. Otherwise it will be ignored.

triggerUploadFolder.description: You can specify an upload folder that will overwrite the one configured in the transfer site settings(if allowed in the transfer site). Expression language can be used to specify the new upload folder.

archivePolicyOnFailure.description: Backup the files in the configured archive folder if the step execution fails. By default will archive the files based on the account configuration.

archivePolicyOnSuccess.description: Backup the files in the configured archive folder if the step execution succeeds. By default will archive the files based on the account configuration.

postRoutingActionRenameExpression.description: Post transformation action rename expression for step.

triggerTargetAccountExpressionType.description: Target account expression type on trigger.

triggerTransferProfileExpressionType.description: Transfer profile expression type on trigger.

RouteStepPullFromPartner.description: A representation of a route step of type PullFromPartner

transferSiteExpression.description: This value should be specified as concatenation of transfer sites or expressions with a separator "#!#CVD#!#". Examples - transfer_site_name#!#CVD#!#, transfer_site_name1#!#CVD#!#transfer_site_name2#!#CVD#!#, transfer_site_name_expression#!#CVD#!#

transferSiteExpressionType.description: Specifies whether a list of site names or an expression will be used for the transferSiteExpression parameter.

remoteFolderPathExpression.description: Path or expression translating to the path from where the file(s) would be downloaded from.

remoteFileNameExpression.description: Name or expression translating to a name or a pattern that wold be used to filter the file(s) in the remote folder.

localFolderPathExpression.description: Path or expression translating to the path where the downloaded file(s) would be stored.

localFileNameExpression.description: Value or expression that would be used when naming downloaded the files.

actionOnStepFailure.description: Action on step failure. If set to PROCEED, the route execution will continue even if the step execution fails.

RouteStepExecuteRoute.description: A representation of a route step of type ExecuteRoute

type.description: Route step type. ExecuteRoute step links the routes of type TEMPLATE and SIMPLE. The next steps are used with SIMPLE route type.

host.description: The host of the client that's connected to the daemon

userClass.description: The user class. By default the user class can be 'VirtClass' or 'RealClass'

command.description: The command currently being executed. Like STOR, RETR, IDLE.

sessionCreationTime.description: The creation time of the session.

serverName.description: The name of the server from which this sessions is initiated.

userClass.description: The user class. By default the user class can be 'VirtClass' or 'RealClass'

instantaneousFTPBandwidth.description: The instantaneous FTP bandwidth. For example '0 bytes/sec'.

HTTPSite.description: A representation of an HTTP(S) site.

host.description: Specify the remote site server host.

port.description: Specify the remote site server port.

useUri.description: Specify whether to define partner URL or not. If it's 'false', 'host' and 'port' should be specified. Otherwise 'url' should be specified.

dmz.description: Specify the remote site network zone.

downloadFolderAdvancedExpressionEnabled.description: When it is 'true' the download folder is evaluated using expression language.

downloadPatternAdvancedExpressionEnabled.description: When it is 'true' the download pattern is evaluated using expression language.

uploadFolderOverridable.description: Defines if the upload folder can be modified by the Send To Partner routing step.

transferMode.description: Specify the transfer mode. It can be A (Ascii), I (Binary). When it is not define the transfer mode is Auto detected.

isSecure.description: Specify if HTTPS is used or not.

fipsMode.description: Specify if the FIPS Transfer Mode is enabled or disabled. This property can be set if HTTPS (issecure) is used.

usePassword.description: Specify if the login password should be set.

usePasswordExpr.description: Specify whether to have password expressions or not.

password.description: Specify the site login password encrypted in 'AES128'. This property should be set if 'usePassword' is 'true'.

clientCertificate.description: The client certificate ID used for mutual authentication.

requestMode.description: The value of the requestMode property

protocols.description: Enabled SSL protocols for http site.

name.description: The type of the site. Acts as a discriminator.

type.description: Type of the site.

transferType.description: The transfer type of the site. It can be unspecified (N), internal (I), partner(E)

maxConcurrentConnection.description: The max concurrent connection of the site

default.description: Defines whether it is a default site. Only site from type PeSIT can be marked as 'Default'

accessLevel.description: The access level for this site.

account.description: The account for which the site is created

additionalAttributes.description:
Additional attributes which are defined with "key": "value" pairs. Keys must start with "userVars." prefix, follow the pattern: [a-zA-Z0-9_.]+
and have length between 10 and 255 characters (including the prefix). Non prefixed part of key should not start with "userVars.", since it is
a reserved word. Both key and value cannot be blank.

deleteOnTempFailOut.description: Defines whether to delete the destination file on temporary failure after the transmission.

deleteOnSuccessIn.description: Defines whether to delete the source file on success after the transmission.

deleteOnPermFailOut.description: Defines whether to delete the destination file on failure after the transmission.

deleteOnPermFailIn.description: Defines whether to delete the source file on failure after the transmission.

doAsOut.description: Specify a value to send the file with a different name. An expression language can be used to specify a file name e.g. ${stenv['target']}_${random()}.

doAsIn.description: Specify a value to receive the file with a different name. An expression language can be used to specify a file name e.g. ${stenv['target']}_${random()}.

id.description: The id of the site alternative address

host.description: The host/url of the alternative address.

port.description: The port of the alternative address.

AdhocSite.description: A representation of an Adhoc site.

securityLevel.description: Specify the delivery method of the site.

challenge.description: Specify secret question. This property should be defined only when 'securityLevel' is 'CHALLENGED_LINK'

response.description: Specify the answer to the secret question. This property should be defined only when 'securityLevel' is 'CHALLENGED_LINK'

confirmResponse.description: Confirm the answer to the secret question. This property should be defined only when 'securityLevel' is 'CHALLENGED_LINK'

notificationTemplate.description: Specify the notification mail template of the site.

expiration.description: Specify the site expiration interval in minutes.

fromEmailAddress.description: Specify the From email address. If not specified, the e-mail of the user account will be used.

toEmailAddresses.description: Specify the TO email addresses. Separate email addresses by semicolon (;).

ccEmailAddresses.description: Specify the CC email addresses. Separate email addresses by semicolon (;).

bccEmailAddresses.description: Specify the BCC email addresses. Separate email addresses by semicolon (;).

body.description: Specify the message to be sent.

sendAs.description: Specify a value to send the file with a different name. An expression language can be used to specify a file name e.g. ${stenv['target']}_${random()}.

sendFileAsAttachment.description: Specify whether to send the file also as an email attachment.

AS2Site.description: A representation of an AS2 site.

senderAs2Id.description: Specify the server site AS2 name. Each AS2 transfer site for a user must have a unique Server AS2 Name(senderAs2Id) or Remote Site AS2 Name (receiverAs2Id).

receiverAs2Id.description: Specify the remote site AS2 name. Each AS2 transfer site for a user must have a unique Server AS2 Name(senderAs2Id) or Remote Site AS2 Name (receiverAs2Id).

dmz.description: Specify the remote site network zone. It can be 'any', 'none', 'Default' or custom network zone.

fipsMode.description: Specify if the FIPS transfer mode is enabled.

protocols.description: Enabled SSL protocols for as2 site.

remoteEncryptionCertificate.description: encrypt X509Certificate alias in the keystore for this partner

remoteSigningCertificate.description: signs X509Certificate alias in the keystore for this partner.

serverEncryptionCertificate.description: encrypt X509Certificate alias in the keystore for this server

serverSigningCertificate.description: signs X509Certificate alias in the keystore for this server.

doAsOut.description: Specify a value to send the file with a different name. An expression language can be used to specify a file name e.g. '${stenv['target']}_${random()}'.

doAsIn.description: Specify a value to receive the file with a different name. An expression language can be used to specify a file name e.g. '${stenv['target']}_${random()}'.

clientCertificate.description: The client certificate ID used for mutual authentication.

senderPassword.description: Specify the site sender password encrypted in 'AES128'.

requireSsl.description: Specify if SSL Connection is required.

requireBA.description: Specify if Basic Authentication is required.

receiverUserName.description: Specify the site receiver username. This property should be set if 'requireBA' is 'true'.

receiverPassword.description: Specify the site receiver password encrypted in 'AES128'. This property should be set if 'requireBA' is 'true'.

enableChunked.description: Specify if file chunking is enabled (large files are sent in multiple parts).

as2MdnReturnUrl.description: Specify if the receipt request should be asynchronous or synchronous. If this property is specified, than the requests are asynchronous, otherwise synchronous. It can be 'HTTP' or 'HTTPS'.

as2MdnUrl.description: Specify if site should request receipt for all transfers. Anything but empty or null value will trigger STAS2Sender to put MDN headers in message.

as2MdnOptions.description: Specify mdn options e.g 'signed-receipt-protocol=optional, pkcs7-signature; signed-receipt-micalg=optional, sha1'.

encrypt.description: Specify encryption. It can be '3des', 'rc2' (RC2/40), 'rc2/64', 'rc2/128'. NOTE: RC2/40, RC2/64 and RC2/128 are not FIPS compilant.

compress.description: Specify if the message should be compressed.

transferTimeout.description: Specify the transfer timeout in seconds.

ConnectDirectSite.description: A representation of an Connect:Direct site.

usePassword.description: Specify if the login password should be set. With Connect:Direct, this field is NOT required only when either (or both) field "siteTemplate" or field "useCertificate" is set.

usePasswordExpr.description: Specify whether to have password expressions or not.

password.description: Specify the site login password encrypted in 'AES128'. This property should be set if 'usePassword' is 'true'.

useCertificate.description: Specify if the login certificate should bet set. With Connect:Direct, this field is NOT required only when either (or both) field "siteTemplate" or field "usePassword" is set.

certificateId.description: Speficy the site login certificate's id. This property should be set if 'useCertificate' is 'true'.

submitScriptWithinFile.description: Specify if the script contains unicode characters and has to be submitted within a file.

siteTemplate.description: The site template of the site

FTPSite.description: A representation of an FTP(S) site.

host.description: Specify the remote site server host.

port.description: Specify the remote site server port.

dmz.description: Specify the remote site network zone. It can be 'any', 'none', 'Default' or custom network zone.

activeMode.description: Define whether the Active Connection Mode is enabled.

downloadFolderAdvancedExpressionEnabled.description: When it is 'true' the download folder is evaluated using expression language.

downloadPatternAdvancedExpressionEnabled.description: When it is 'true' the download pattern is evaluated using expression language.

uploadFolderOverridable.description: Defines if the upload folder can be modified by the Send To Partner routing step.

uploadCommand.description: Specify the FTP upload command that will be used when server initiated transfer is executed.

preferredMethod.description: Specify the preferred FTP command when entering FTP passive mode.

matchAnyLineTerminators.description: Tanscode any line terminators in ASCII mode.

hostnameVerification.description: Verify if the remote host taking part of a data connection is the same as the host to which the control connection is attached.

isSecure.description: Specify if FTPS is used or not.

verifyCert.description: Verify certificate for this site. 'true' indicates that remote server's certificate should be verified. 'false' indicates that remote server's certificate should not be verified.

ccc.description: Clear command channel. 'true' indicates if Clear Command Channel option should be used when connecting to site, 'false' if not to be used.

tlsShutdownCcc.description: TLC Shutdown on CCC. 'true' means that the client should shutdown TLS session on 'Clear Command Channel' and 'false' that it should not shutdown the TLS session on 'Clear Command Channel'.

fipsMode.description: Specify if the FIPS Transfer Mode is enabled or disabled. This property can be set if FTPS (issecure) is used. disabled.

usePassword.description: Specify if the login password should be set.

password.description: Specify the site login password encrypted in 'AES128'. This property should be set if 'usePassword' is 'true'.

usePasswordExpr.description: Specify whether to have password expressions or not.

clientCertificate.description: The client certificate ID used for mutual authentication.

protocols.description: Enabled SSL protocols for ftp site.

SSHSite.description: A representation of an SSH site.

host.description: Specify the remote site server host.

port.description: Specify the remote site server port.

dmz.description: Specify the remote site network zone.

downloadFolderAdvancedExpressionEnabled.description: When it is 'true' the download folder is evaluated using expression language.

downloadPatternAdvancedExpressionEnabled.description: When it is 'true' the download pattern is evaluated using expression language.

downloadPatternType.description: Specify the download pattern type. Pattern matching expression supports 'glob' and 'regex' syntaxes.When the pattern type is "File Globbing" then the String representation of the filename is matched using a limited pattern language that resembles regular expressions but with a simpler syntax.

uploadFolderOverridable.description: Defines if the upload folder can be modified by the Send To Partner routing step.

updatePermissionsWithChmodCommand.description: Determines whether to use chmod or umask command to change file permissions. This setting overrides the global setting configured via the Ssh.UpdateFilePermissionsWithChmodCommand option. The possible values are - null(Default) - The global setting is applied; True - The file permissions, specified in the SSH transfer site, are set after transfer ends with chmod; False - The file handler is opened with specified permissions. The file permissions are set with umask. There is no need to edit the Upload Permissions field - correct format is automatically set.

verifyFinger.description: Defines whther to verify fingerprint for this site or not.

fipsMode.description: Specify if the FIPS Transfer Mode is enabled or disabled. This property can be set if FTPS (issecure) is used.

usePassword.description: Specify if the login password should be set.

usePasswordExpr.description: Specify whether to have password expressions or not.

password.description: Specify the site login password encrypted in 'AES128'. This property should be set if 'usePassword' is 'true'.

socketTimeout.description: Specify the maximum number of seconds the server waits to read a block of data from the partner server, or write a block of data to the partner server. If not specified, its value is '300' - 300 seconds. This option corresponds to the SO_RCVTIMEO and SO_SNDTIMEO Socket options.

connectionIdleTimeout.description: Specify the maximum length of time that a connection can stay active when no traffic is sent through the connection. If not specified, its value is '300' - 300 seconds.

socketBufferSize.description: Specify the size of the receive buffer in bytes used from the socket opened during the transfer. It is used by the platform's networking code as a hint for the size to set the underlying network I/O buffers. Increasing the receive buffer size can increase the performance of network I/O for high-volume connection, while decreasing it can help reduce the backlog of incoming data. This value is also used to set the TCP receive window that is advertized to the remote peer. This option corresponds to the SO_RCVBUF. The value should be a positive integer.

socketSendBufferSize.description: Specify the size of the send buffer in bytes used from the socket opened during the transfer. It is used by the platform's networking code as a hint for the size to set the underlying network I/O buffers. This option corresponds to the SO_SNDBUF. The value should be a positive integer.

bufferSize.description: Specify the size of the buffer in bytes used for reading from the local file system when performing the transfer. This setting is used to optimize the writing of files by allowing large chunk of data to be read in one operation from a local file. The value should be a positive integer. This setting should be set to the highest value possible.

blockSize.description: Specify the SFTP block size value used for the transfer. The value should be a positive integer greater or equal to 512. The defaults value is 32768. It is not recommended to increase the value, more than the default one as the remote server may not be able to support higher block sizes.

tcpNoDelay.description: Enable TCP_NODELAY (disable/enable Nagle's algorithm) for the transfer.

clientCertificate.description: The client certificate ID used for mutual authentication.

protocols.description: Enabled SSL protocols for ssh site.

keyExchangeAlgorithms.description: Key exchange algorithms for ssh site.

PeSITSite.description: A representation of an PeSIT site.

pesitId.description: Specify the PeSIT ID which will be used for defining the PeSIT partnership.

port.description: Specify the remote partner port.

dmz.description: Specify the remote partner network zone. It can be 'any', 'none', 'Default' or custom network zone.

configurePreconnection.description: Specify if Pre-Connection should be set.

preconnectionPartnerId.description: Specify the partner id used for Pre-Connection.

usePreconnectionPartnerPassword.description: Specify if the Pre-Connection partner password should be set.

usePreconnectionPartnerPasswordExpr.description: Specify whether to have Pre-Connection partner password expressions or not.

preconnectionPartnerPassword.description: Specify the partner password encrypted in 'AES128'. It is used for Pre-Connection.

preconnectionServerId.description: Specify the server id used for Pre-Connection.

usePreconnectionServerPassword.description: Specify if the Pre-Connection server password should be set.

usePreconnectionServerPasswordExpr.description: Specify whether to have Pre-Connection server password expressions or not.

preconnectionServerPassword.description: Specify the server password encrypted in 'AES128'. It is used for preconnection.

useServerPassword.description: Specify if the server password should be set.

useServerPasswordExpr.description: Specify whether to have server password expressions or not.

serverPassword.description: Specify the server password encrypted in 'AES128'. This property should be set if 'useServerPassword' is 'true'.

usePartnerPassword.description: Specify if the partner password should be set.

usePartnerPasswordExpr.description: Specify whether to have partner password expressions or not.

partnerPassword.description: Specify the partner password encrypted in 'AES128'. This property should be set if 'usePartnerPassword' is 'true'.

compression.description: Specify the transfer compression. It can be 0 (None), 1 (Horizontal), 2 (Vertical) or 3 (Both).

resyncAllowed.description: Specify if the resync is allowed.

connectionTimeout.description: Overwrites the value specified in Pesit.Client.Inactivity.Timeout configuration option. It is used to determine how much time (in seconds) ST will wait for acknowledgment command for transfer end, when pushing file to a server, when ST acts as a PeSIT client.

bufferSize.description: Specify the PeSIT buffer size. This option is used when SecureTransport is acting as a PeSIT client. Specifies the maximum size of a PeSIT data element (PI 25). Should be greater than 800 bytes and less than 65535.

sendMessage.description: Specify a user send message. An expression language can be used e.g. ${pesit.serverID}.

storeAndForwardMode.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. All the advanced PeSIT settings are included or all are ommitted. "Preserve" Store and Forward mode will preserve the current Store and Forward transfer (if any). "Start new" will initiate a new Store and Forward transfer and the current transfer (if any) will be acknowledged.

originator.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. Use this field to override the original sender (PI61) of the transfer. To preserve the original value use ${pesit.pi.originalSenderID}.

finalDestination.description: Advanced PeSIT Setting. Use this field to override the final destination (PI62) of the transfer. To preserve the original value use ${pesit.pi.finalDestinationID}. To make a Store and Forward PeSIT transfer specify the final destination and choose the intermediate partner (ipart parameter in Axway Transfer CFT) in the transfer site list.

ptcpConnections.description: Specify the number of parallel TCP connections.

socketSendReceiveBuffersize.description: This option is used when SecureTransport is acting as a PeSIT client. Specifies the TCP Socket maximum send and receive buffer size in bytes. This setting corresponds to SO_SNDBUF and SO_RCVBUF socket parameters.

ptcpConnectRetryCount.description: This option is used when SecureTransport is acting as a PeSIT client. It specifies the maximum times the SecureTransport will attempt to re-establish a connection with the remote server in case of "Unknown session" error.

isSecure.description: Specify if TLS/SSL is used or not.

verifyCert.description: This option is used when SecureTransport is acting as a PeSIT client. Verify whether the server certificate of the partner is chained to a trusted root. This property can be set if TLS/SSL (issecure) is used.

fipsMode.description: Specify if the FIPS Transfer Mode is enabled or disabled. This property can be set if TLS/SSL (issecure) is used.

cftCompatibleSslMode.description: Enable Legasy transfer CFT compatible SSL mode. This property can be set if TLS/SSL (issecure) is used and the 'Clear Command Channel' is enabled.

loginCertificate.description: The client certificate ID used for mutual authentication.

partnerCertificate.description: The partner certificate ID used for mutual authentication.

protocols.description: Enabled SSL protocols for ssh site.

FolderMonitorSite.description: A representation of an Folder Monitor site.

downloadFolderAdvancedExpressionEnabled.description: When it is 'true' the download folder is evaluated using expression language.

downloadFolder.description: Specify the download folder. When 'download.folder.advanced.expression.enabled' is checked the download folder is evaluated using expression language.

downloadPatternAdvancedExpressionEnabled.description: When it is 'true' the download pattern is evaluated using expression language.

downloadPatternType.description: Specify the download pattern type. Pattern matching expression supports 'glob' and 'regex' syntaxes.When the pattern type is "File Globbing" then the String representation of the filename is matched using a limited pattern language that resembles regular expressions but with a simpler syntax.

downloadPatternCaseSensitive.description: Defines whether the download pattern is case sensitive.

downloadSubfolderMaxDepth.description: Specify the maximum depth of the subfolders to monitor.

downloadSubfolderPatternType.description: Specify the dowlnload pattern type. Pattern matching expression supports 'glob' and 'regex' syntaxes. When the pattern type is "File Globbing" then the String representation of the filename is matched using a limited pattern language that resembles regular expressions but with a simpler syntax.

downloadSubfolderPattern.description: Specify the pattern used to match folder names to determine whether to apply the download pattern to the folder.

downloadSubfolderPatternCaseSensitive.description: Defines whether the subfolder download pattern is case sensitive.

uploadFolderExpressionSupport.description: When it is 'true' the upload folder is evaluated using expression language.

uploadFolderAutocreate.description: Defines if the Upload Folder will be automatically created if it doesn't exist.The automatically created folder will be owned by the user running the SecureTransport TM Server process. Privileges are calculated according to the OS umask (not the Users.DefaultUmask Server Configuration parameter).

uploadFolderOverridable.description: Defines if the upload folder can be modified by the Send To Partner routing step.
